Title: Data Analyst
Description:
From Barcelona, you will join Germany-based Corporate Start-Up B. Braun New Ventures, which is taking a leading role in the digital transformation of healthcare. With a young and fast-growing team, we develop solutions to automate medical procedures across various business areas. From our Barcelona location, you will be integrated into an international team that collaborates to achieve these goals.

Responsibilities:


Collect, analyze, and interpret complex healthcare and operational data to derive actionable insights that drive business decisions
Design, build, and optimize data pipelines and workflows using Databricks, SQL, and other relevant technologies
Create dashboards and reports using visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) to communicate findings effectively to stakeholders
Collaborate closely with data engineers, cloud architects, product managers, and software developers to integrate analytics into digital products and cloud-based solutions
Develop and implement statistical models, machine learning algorithms, and predictive analytics to enhance data-driven decision-making
Ensure data integrity, governance, and compliance with industry standards and regulatory requirements
Work in an agile and cross-functional team, contributing to the continuous improvement of data analytics strategies and best practices


Professional competencies:


Several years of experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in the healthcare, medical technology, or cloud-based product industry
Strong SQL skills and experience working with Databricks, Python, or R for data analysis and modeling
Experience with cloud data platforms (Azure, AWS, or GCP) and tools such as Delta Lake, Apache Spark, or Snowflake
Proficient in data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar
Strong understanding of data governance, ETL processes, and data warehousing concepts
Experience working in an agile environment with multidisciplinary teams
Familiar with machine learning techniques, statistical analysis, and predictive modeling (a plus)
Experience in the healthcare industry or a comparable regulated environment (a plus)


Personal competencies:


Proactive, results-oriented, and analytical thinker with problem-solving skills
Work effectively in multidisciplinary teams, encourage collaboration (including virtual teams), and foster mutual support
Hands-on mentality and a passion for transforming data into meaningful insights
Productive and capable of acting in critical situations
Communicate clearly and responsibly in English. Spanish and German are nice to have


B. Braun Medical, S.A. U. | Soledad Barragán López

Title: Data Analyst, Tracking & Analytics
Description:
Are you eager to develop and implement tracking and analytics solutions that help large international companies make informed decisions? Do you want to join our ambitious journey within data tracking & analytics? Are you ready to to make a real impact on how global brands use data?

At s360, we're not just collecting data – we're turning it into actionable insights that drive business growth. Join our new team in Barcelona and help shape the future of ad-tech in a dynamic, startup-like environment while being part of a leading North European agency.

Your Key Responsibilities

You will play a crucial role in delivering and advising on tracking and analytics solutions for our clients. Overall your responsibilities will encompass the development and implementation of durable measurement and tracking setups.

More Specifically, Your Responsibilities Will Include


Responsible for own portfolio of clients within tracking & analytics
Driving strategic roadmaps towards a durable measurement setup
Planning, project management and execution as primary or part of projects for clients on an ad hoc basis
Advising and configuration of e.g. Google Analytics 4, Consent Mode, Enhanced Conversions, Conversion API, and Consent Management Platform (Cookiebot and Cookie Information)
Testing, auditing, and ensuring the quality of tracking setups
Developing documentation and implementing both smaller and larger tracking setups
Implementing and adjusting conversion tracking/pixel across various channels and platforms
Debugging and resolving ad hoc tracking issues


About Your Future Team

You will join our Measurement team who each day collaborate to make sure our clients succeed. We strive to work closely on projects, complex cases, and troubleshooting while having fun and prioritising the social aspects of working together. Staying ahead with the latest technologies and products is part of our DNA, ensuring our clients gain a competitive advantage through future-proof tracking setups.

Moreover, as part of our new Barcelona team, you’ll contribute to building a collaborative environment. You will help shape the growth of our office and contribute to building a culture that thrives on innovation, teamwork and the shared goal of delivering exceptional results for our clients.

Your profile

You have 4-6 years of hands-on experience from e.g. a digital agency or an inhouse role in a digital company. You possess high professionalism as well as personal integrity and thrive in a fast-paced environment, where we constantly strive to improve and create more value for our clients.

Furthermore, You


High-level user of Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager for ecommerce
Have a working knowledge on HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Have experience in driving larger tracking & analytics projects for complex setups and client organisations
Comfortable explaining complex and technical concepts both verbally and in writing
Able to communicate in English with colleagues and external stakeholders from various locations
Are a problem-solver, unafraid of tackling challenging tasks
Are detail-oriented and structured, taking pride in delivering thorough solutions
Have a direct and open communication style, and you are comfortable with giving and receiving constructive feedback
Appreciate collaborative sparring and knowledge-sharing within the team, coupled with the ability to work independently and manage tasks in a structured manner


Note: You must be eligible to work in Spain and the EU without requiring sponsorship.

What We Offer

You will be a part of a strong team with some of the industry’s top specialists who all strive to ensure that our next delivery is always better than before. You will join an international team working with clients across the s360 group.

Moreover, you will be a part of a company characterised by:


A culture that is down-to-earth and full of constructive feedback and sparring that drives your personal and professional development
Freedom under responsibility and flexible working hours
Ambitious and professional colleagues - who also like to have fun!
Continuous learning and development opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career.
Social events like our MeetUp for all s360-employees


Our office in the popular Norrsken House Barcelona offers the city’s best location with views of the beach and W-hotel, as well as many social and networking activities.

We’d love to hear from you!

Is this the right fit for you? Then don’t hesitate to apply or reach out to Andrej Plancic, Managing Director, at [email protected].

We review applications on an ongoing basis and hire as soon as the right candidate is found, so please send your CV and application as soon as possible. All inquiries are treated confidentially.

About S360

s360 is a leading Northern European digital marketing agency that helps brands and retailers grow by providing a strong tech foundation, best-in-class execution, and deep industry expertise. With a team of +300 digital specialists, s360 operates ten offices across seven countries: Denmark, Finland, Norway, Sweden, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands, and Spain. In recent years, s360 has been recognised with numerous national and European awards, making it one of Europe's most award-winning digital marketing agencies.

Title: Junior data analyst - data migration team
Description:
Junior data analyst - Equipo de migración de datos

Sobre El Puesto

Buscamos un/a Junior Data Analyst para unirse a nuestro equipo de migración de datos en el sector educativo. Esta persona será responsable de apoyar en procesos de ETL (extracción, transformación y carga de datos), análisis de información y validación de datos en sistemas ERP.

Responsabilidades


Colaborar en la recopilación, limpieza y validación de datos para garantizar su integridad y calidad.
Ejecutar procesos de migración de datos y dar soporte en tareas de ETL.
Analizar ficheros de datos para identificar errores, inconsistencias o duplicados.
Generar informes y dashboards para evaluar la migración y detectar posibles mejoras.
Colaborar con el equipo técnico en la optimización de procesos de migración.
Documentar los procedimientos y metodologías utilizadas en la gestión de datos.
Apoyar en la automatización de procesos y en la mejora continua de la migración de datos.


Requisitos


Grado en Estadística, Matemáticas, Ingeniería Informática, Ciencia de Datos o campos relacionados.
Experiencia previa en análisis de datos (prácticas o roles junior).
Conocimientos de SQL y bases de datos relacionales.
Habilidad en el uso de herramientas de visualización de datos (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Conocimientos básicos de Python o R para el análisis y manipulación de datos.
Capacidad analítica, atención al detalle y resolución de problemas.
Buenas habilidades de comunicación y trabajo en equipo.
Nivel intermedio de inglés y fluidez en catalán/español.


Ofrecemos


Contrato indefinido y modelo de trabajo híbrido en Barcelona.
Flexibilidad horaria y jornada intensiva los viernes y en verano.
Oportunidades de formación y crecimiento profesional.
Programa de beneficios flexibles


About Sanoma Learning

How do you prepare students for the world, engage their curiosity and inspire them to grow? That is the main question of teachers all around the world. At Sanoma Learning, it has always been our mission to help to find and develop best-in-class answers to this question. If you join us, it means that you embark on an exciting journey to help shape the future of learning for primary, secondary and vocational education. We believe that your journey is our success as a company.

Sanoma Learning is a leading K12 European learning company, operating in 12 countries. Our learning products and services enable and support teachers and schools to develop the talents of every child to reach their potential. By offering printed and digital learning content, as well as digital learning and teaching platforms for primary, secondary and vocational education, we want to grow our positive impact on learning across Europe. With over 3000 employees, we help shape the future of education for 25+ million of students.

So, are you ready to start your journey to help shape the future of learning and help teachers to support all students to reach their potential?

Sanoma Learning is an equal opportunity employer; we are committed to inclusion and diversity, ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or any other characteristics.
Show more
HTML:
Junior data analyst - Equipo de migración de datos

Sobre El Puesto

Buscamos un/a Junior Data Analyst para unirse a nuestro equipo de migración de datos en el sector educativo. Esta persona será responsable de apoyar en procesos de ETL (extracción, transformación y carga de datos), análisis de información y validación de datos en sistemas ERP.

Responsabilidades

  • Colaborar en la recopilación, limpieza y validación de datos para garantizar su integridad y calidad.
  • Ejecutar procesos de migración de datos y dar soporte en tareas de ETL.
  • Analizar ficheros de datos para identificar errores, inconsistencias o duplicados.
  • Generar informes y dashboards para evaluar la migración y detectar posibles mejoras.
  • Colaborar con el equipo técnico en la optimización de procesos de migración.
  • Documentar los procedimientos y metodologías utilizadas en la gestión de datos.
  • Apoyar en la automatización de procesos y en la mejora continua de la migración de datos.

Requisitos

  • Grado en Estadística, Matemáticas, Ingeniería Informática, Ciencia de Datos o campos relacionados.
  • Experiencia previa en análisis de datos (prácticas o roles junior).
  • Conocimientos de SQL y bases de datos relacionales.
  • Habilidad en el uso de herramientas de visualización de datos (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
  • Conocimientos básicos de Python o R para el análisis y manipulación de datos.
  • Capacidad analítica, atención al detalle y resolución de problemas.
  • Buenas habilidades de comunicación y trabajo en equipo.
  • Nivel intermedio de inglés y fluidez en catalán/español.

Ofrecemos

  • Contrato indefinido y modelo de trabajo híbrido en Barcelona.
  • Flexibilidad horaria y jornada intensiva los viernes y en verano.
  • Oportunidades de formación y crecimiento profesional.
  • Programa de beneficios flexibles

About Sanoma Learning

How do you prepare students for the world, engage their curiosity and inspire them to grow? That is the main question of teachers all around the world. At Sanoma Learning, it has always been our mission to help to find and develop best-in-class answers to this question. If you join us, it means that you embark on an exciting journey to help shape the future of learning for primary, secondary and vocational education. We believe that your journey is our success as a company.

Sanoma Learning is a leading K12 European learning company, operating in 12 countries. Our learning products and services enable and support teachers and schools to develop the talents of every child to reach their potential. By offering printed and digital learning content, as well as digital learning and teaching platforms for primary, secondary and vocational education, we want to grow our positive impact on learning across Europe. With over 3000 employees, we help shape the future of education for 25+ million of students.

So, are you ready to start your journey to help shape the future of learning and help teachers to support all students to reach their potential?

Sanoma Learning is an equal opportunity employer; we are committed to inclusion and diversity, ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or any other characteristics.

Title: DATA ANALYST
Description:
Somos una compañía global, líder en el desarrollo de infraestructuras regenerativas que generan un impacto positivo en la sociedad. Nuestra plantilla, formada por más de 65.000 profesionales y presente en más de 40 países de los cinco continentes, contribuye a nuestra misión de diseñar un planeta mejor. Buscamos personas que quieran marcar la diferencia, promover el desarrollo sostenible y encontrar soluciones a los mayores desafíos globales, incluidos el cambio climático, la sobrepoblación y la escasez hídrica. Únete a nosotros en la búsqueda de soluciones para lograr un futuro sostenible.

Descripción del puesto

El/La Data Analyst será responsable de la construcción y mantenimiento de dashboards en PowerBI, la definición y gestión de KPIs y la creación de data products para apoyar la toma de decisiones del negocio. Además, liderará la identificación, documentación y migración de los servicios de datos actuales hacia una nueva arquitectura medallón en GCP, asegurando la trazabilidad y gobernanza de los datos.

Requisitos del candidato

PRINCIPALES FUNCIONES Y RESPONSABILIDADES


Diseñar, desarrollar y mantener dashboards en Power BI que proporcionen información clave para las áreas de negocio.
Identificar y documentar los servicios de datos existentes (CdM, dashboards, KPIs, informes), asegurando la trazabilidad y calidad de los datos.
Liderar la migración de los servicios de datos actuales a una arquitectura medallón en GCP, garantizando la continuidad y optimización del análisis de datos.
Actuar como interfaz con las áreas de negocio para entender sus necesidades analíticas y traducirlas en soluciones de datos efectivas.
Colaborar con el Data Engineer en el diseño y modelado de datamarts optimizados para la explotación en Power BI.
Impulsar la gobernanza de datos en la empresa mediante la construcción de un Business Glossary y un Diccionario de Datos.


PERFIL DE LA PERSONA


Formación reglada: Ingeniería informática o similar.
Formación no reglada / Complementaria: Sólidos conocimientos de modelados de datos y definición de datamarts en entornos analíticos. Conocimiento de arquitecturas de datos modernas, preferiblemente en Google Cloud Platform, y experiencia en migraciones de datos. Conocimientos en Data Governance, con capacidad para estructurar y construir en Business Glossary y un Diccionario de Datos.
Experiencia: Más de 5 años en posición similar. Experiencia demostrable en el desarrollo de dashboards y modelos de datos en Power BI. Experiencia en la documentación de flujos de datos, trazabilidad y gobernanza de datos. Experiencia en SQL y herramientas ETL para transformación y análisis de datos será valorada.
Otros: Persona organizada, con iniciativa y sentido de la responsabilidad. Acostumbrada a trabajar en ambientes laborales dinámicos. Habilidades de análisis y comunicación para interactuar con steakholders de negocio y entender sus necesidades. Capacidad para trabajar de manera autónoma como el único Data Analyst de la Compañía, con visión estratégica y enfoque a resultados.


Somos una compañía que valora la diversidad como fuente de talento y por ello trabajamos para impulsar un entorno inclusivo en el que se promueve el respeto, la pertenencia y el compromiso de forma que todas las personas puedan participar en igualdad de oportunidades. Invitamos a todas las personas a inscribirse con independencia del origen, circunstancias, bagaje o condición. ACCIONA ha recibido la certificación Top Employer 2021, 2022, 2023, 2024 y 2025, que reconoce a la Compañía como una de las mejores empresas para trabajar en España.
Show more

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Join Proton and build a better internet where privacy is the default

At Proton, we believe that privacy is a fundamental human right and the cornerstone of democracy. Since our inception in 2014, founded by a team of scientists from CERN, we have dedicated ourselves to providing free and open-source technology to millions worldwide, ensuring access to privacy, security, and freedom online.

Our journey began with Proton Mail, the largest secure email service globally, and has since expanded to include Proton VPN, Proton Calendar, Proton Drive, and Proton Pass. These tools empower individuals and organizations to take control of their personal data, break away from Big Tech’s invasive practices, and defeat censorship. Our work impacts hundreds of millions of lives, from activists on the front lines defending freedom to leaders in governments protecting sensitive information. In some cases, Proton’s services have even been instrumental in saving lives by enabling secure and private communications in high-risk situations.

Proton is a profitable company that does not rely upon VC funding, supporting over 100 million user accounts with a growing team of over 500 people from over 50 different countries, from the world's top companies and universities. We value intelligence, learning potential, and ambition in our hiring process. Adaptability is key as we navigate uncharted territories and redefine how business is conducted online.

Hiring at Proton is highly selective, with less than 1% of candidates hired. We believe smaller teams of exceptional talent will always prevail over larger teams with lower talent density. You will have the opportunity work with many of the world's top minds in their fields, ranging from former international math and science olympiad winners to chess champions.

We have a global mindset and big ambitions but remain a start-up at heart. We value empowerment and flexibility and keep our structure flat to keep moving fast and avoid unnecessary politics. Tired of blending into the crowd? Join us and do work you can truly be proud of. Check our open-source projects here! Check our social media pages to learn more about us: Twitter, Reddit, Instagram.

Purpose of the role

We are looking for a talented Marketing Data Analyst to support data-driven decision-making in the Marketing department. You will be embedded within the marketing team and play a key role in understanding customer behaviour, guiding marketing initiatives, and analysing the performance of various campaigns, A/B tests, etc.. Your insights will directly influence strategies, helping the team optimise marketing efforts. You will be part of the Marketing team, but you will collaborate also with the Data team, which consists of data science and data engineering, to continuously enhance your data platform and reporting tools.

This role requires good knowledge of measurement techniques, combined with the ability to create actionable insights for Marketing & cross-functional teams. You will work closely with growth, performance marketing, data and product teams to drive better decision-making through data-driven strategies.

What You Will Do



Support marketing team members in making data-driven decisions by analysing and interpreting marketing data, especially A/B test results and incremental tests used to measure our campaign efforts.
Build and maintain dashboards in Metabase, providing marketing teams with clear and actionable insights to optimise campaigns and track performance.
Apply tools and techniques for marketing data analysis and visualisation to measure and improve marketing performance.
Represent and summarise marketing data and insights in clear, actionable reports.
Research new marketing use cases for existing data, and suggest new data sources to incorporate for better analysis.
Share insights, findings, and best practices for marketing analytics with analysts across other business units.
Help shape marketing strategies by providing data-backed recommendations to optimise campaigns and boost ROI.
Develop training programs and enablement sessions to improve data literacy within the marketing team.
Advocate for measurement solutions that align with Proton’s privacy-first mission, ensuring user trust and compliance with privacy regulations such as GDPR. Develop training and enablement programs to increase data literacy



Job Requirements



Bachelor’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (marketing, statistics, mathematics, economics, computer science, etc.).
Strong analytical skills with a focus on marketing metrics.
Experience in business intelligence, marketing KPIs & web analytics.
At least 5 years of relevant working experience in marketing data analysis.
Advanced knowledge of SQL for querying and analysing marketing data.
Proficient in data visualisation tools such as Metabase, Tableau, Power BI, Qlik, or similar platforms.
Familiarity with A/B testing and incremental testing methodologies, and experience with reporting and analysing test results.



Bonus points for:



Experience in high-growth, global technology companies
Familiarity with subscription-based and freemium business models.
Experience in a global, fast-paced, high-growth company environment.



What We Offer



Office First: Collaboration is easier and more effective in person, which is why we have offices in Geneva, Zurich, Prague, Barcelona, Paris, London, Vilnius, Skopje, and Taipei. You can also enjoy working from home up to 30% of the time, while enjoying great company during our three core days in the office.
Technology: We provide all the devices and software you need to excel in your role, ensuring you have the best tools at your disposal to achieve your goals.
Food: Lunch and snacks are provided by Proton every day at our offices.
Transport: We will always support our employees with transport costs through subsidizing public transport, bike allowances, or parking spaces based on your office location.
Stock Options: At Proton, we are all owners of the company and you get stock options when you join us.
Flexible Working: You can define your own working hours as long as it works with team meetings.
Learning and Development: We are committed to your professional growth. Proton offers various learning opportunities, including training programs, conferences and events, and continual learning.
Employee Benefits: Comprehensive health insurance plans, competitive retirement savings options, generous vacation and leave policies, and wellness programs.
Work that Matters: Proton is a community-first organization, started with the support of a crowdfunding campaign and built with community input. To this day, Proton’s only source of revenue is user subscriptions. Over 100 million people trust and support Proton, and we put our users and community first in everything we do. Read more about our impact here.



Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

At Proton, we believe diversity drives innovation and strengthens our mission to provide privacy as a default for all. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where all individuals, regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, physical ability, or socio-economic background, feel valued and empowered. We strive to create equal opportunities, promote open dialogue, and support continuous learning to ensure every voice is heard and respected.

If you need any extra support or reasonable adjustments during the hiring process, please let your talent partner know.

Candidate Privacy Notice

When you apply for a position, refer a candidate, or are considered for a role at Proton Technologies AG (Proton, we, us, or our), your information is stored in Greenhouse, in accordance with their Service Privacy Policy. This information is used to evaluate your suitability for the posted position. We also retain this information for consideration for future roles that you may apply for or that we believe may align with your background and skills.

If we no longer have a legitimate business need to process your information, we will either delete or anonymize it. Should you have any inquiries about how we use or manage your information, or if you wish to access, correct, or delete your data, please contact our privacy team at careers@proton.ch.

Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from candidates. We will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from an unsolicited offer, even if the candidate is subsequently hired by Proton.

To learn more about our privacy policy, please visit our privacy policy page.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Place: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Continua nuestro legado y tradición: ¡únete a Europastry!

Formar parte del equipo Europastry supone querer continuar y evolucionar un legado y una tradición llevándolos a otro nivel. Significa ser un Baker y aportar un talento y valor únicos.

Europastry es un proyecto apasionante que mira al futuro sin perder de vista el pasado. Respetamos nuestros orígenes aprovechando el know-how adquirido durante casi cuatro décadas y, al mismo tiempo, tenemos la libertad y la pasión de reinventarnos e innovar cada día.

Somos una empresa global con presencia en más de 80 países donde diariamente cerca de 5.000 Bakers lideran el mercado de masas congeladas de panadería y bollería. Somos un equipo de valientes que arriesgamos, hacemos que las cosas pasen, y nos esforzamos por ofrecer el mejor producto a nuestros consumidores a través del mejor servicio a nuestros partners.

Somos #Brave #Agile #Keen #Engaged

We are Bakers. ¿Y tú?

Tu misión en pocas palabras

Buscamos un profesional para liderar la integración de nuevos negocios y adquisiciones en nuestro ecosistema de BI. Esta persona desempeñará un papel clave en la transformación de datos, impulsando la calidad y gobernanza de datos en colaboración con diversas áreas de la organización. Buscamos un perfil con visión de negocio, capaz de comprender los procesos empresariales y alinear las soluciones de datos con los objetivos y estrategias corporativas.

¿Cómo sería tu día a día?


Actuar como enlace entre los nuevos negocios y los departamentos internos para homogeneizar datos según estándares corporativos.
Coordinar la integración de datos y procesos de negocio en cubos de BI (Tableau), proporcionando formación y soporte a los usuarios.
Supervisar la calidad de los datos, implementando controles y revisando la precisión de los informes.
Diseñar y ejecutar una estrategia de gestión de datos maestros y gobierno de datos para garantizar la integridad, consistencia y seguridad.
Promover alianzas transversales con líderes de negocio, TI y usuarios de datos para comprender sus necesidades.


Que buscamos en un/a Baker


Grado o Master en ADE, Economía, Ingeniería, Estadística o estudios relacionados.
Experiencia previa en un rol de análisis de datos o BI, de mínimo 1 año, y previa en una posición similar de un mínimo de 3 años.
Conocimiento de herramientas de BI (particularmente Tableau), bases de datos y herramientas de integración y transformación de datos (ETL).
Se valorará experiencia y conocimiento del entorno JD Edwards. y de los principios y mejores prácticas de calidad de datos.
Autonomía, iniciativa y proactividad para liderar proyectos y proponer mejoras de manera constante.
Capacidad de organización y meticulosidad, el cumplimiento de deadlines gestionando múltiples tareas de forma simultánea, así como una alta capacidad analítica.
Un mínimo de un 25% del tiempo el rol se ejercerá directamente en los negocios adquiridos, que pueden ser tanto nacionales como internacionales.


¿Por qué unirte a nuestro equipo?


Oportunidades para el crecimiento profesional dentro de un equipo internacional.
Plan de compensación flexible que incluye seguro de salud, guardería, transporte y comida, adaptado a tus necesidades. Además, incluye un seguro para tu mascota,
Acceso exclusivo a la plataforma Bakers Vip Club, con descuentos en ocio y consumo solo para nuestros colaboradores.
Subvención en el menú de cantina, para que disfrutes de la comida a un coste reducido.
Desayuno Europastry: ¡Empieza tu día con nuestros mejores productos!
Descuento exclusivo para empleados en nuestros productos de Europastry.
¡Acceso a gimnasio y pistas de pádel del recinto para mantener tu bienestar físico!
Viernes tarde con horario intensivo.
Lockers disponibles en el edificio, donde puedes recibir tus pedidos en cualquier momento.


En Europastry, ofrecemos un espacio de trabajo diverso e inclusivo donde todas las personas se sientan valoradas y respetadas. Estamos comprometidos con prácticas de contratación justas y equitativas, implementamos programas de formación para asegurar que toda nuestra plantilla conozca y esté comprometida con estos principios.

Estamos interesados en el valor único que puedes aportar a nuestro equipo, independientemente de cualquier otro aspecto. Por favor, envía un CV que destaque tus logros profesionales y habilidades. No es necesario incluir fotografías ni datos personales que no sean relevantes para la evaluación de tu candidatura.

¿Te gustaría ser Baker?
Show more
HTML:
Continua nuestro legado y tradición: ¡únete a Europastry!

Formar parte del equipo Europastry supone querer continuar y evolucionar un legado y una tradición llevándolos a otro nivel. Significa ser un Baker y aportar un talento y valor únicos.

Europastry es un proyecto apasionante que mira al futuro sin perder de vista el pasado. Respetamos nuestros orígenes aprovechando el know-how adquirido durante casi cuatro décadas y, al mismo tiempo, tenemos la libertad y la pasión de reinventarnos e innovar cada día.

Somos una empresa global con presencia en más de 80 países donde diariamente cerca de 5.000 Bakers lideran el mercado de masas congeladas de panadería y bollería. Somos un equipo de valientes que arriesgamos, hacemos que las cosas pasen, y nos esforzamos por ofrecer el mejor producto a nuestros consumidores a través del mejor servicio a nuestros partners.

Somos #Brave #Agile #Keen #Engaged

We are Bakers. ¿Y tú?

Tu misión en pocas palabras

Buscamos un profesional para liderar la integración de nuevos negocios y adquisiciones en nuestro ecosistema de BI. Esta persona desempeñará un papel clave en la transformación de datos, impulsando la calidad y gobernanza de datos en colaboración con diversas áreas de la organización. Buscamos un perfil con visión de negocio, capaz de comprender los procesos empresariales y alinear las soluciones de datos con los objetivos y estrategias corporativas.

¿Cómo sería tu día a día?

  • Actuar como enlace entre los nuevos negocios y los departamentos internos para homogeneizar datos según estándares corporativos.
  • Coordinar la integración de datos y procesos de negocio en cubos de BI (Tableau), proporcionando formación y soporte a los usuarios.
  • Supervisar la calidad de los datos, implementando controles y revisando la precisión de los informes.
  • Diseñar y ejecutar una estrategia de gestión de datos maestros y gobierno de datos para garantizar la integridad, consistencia y seguridad.
  • Promover alianzas transversales con líderes de negocio, TI y usuarios de datos para comprender sus necesidades.

Que buscamos en un/a Baker

  • Grado o Master en ADE, Economía, Ingeniería, Estadística o estudios relacionados.
  • Experiencia previa en un rol de análisis de datos o BI, de mínimo 1 año, y previa en una posición similar de un mínimo de 3 años.
  • Conocimiento de herramientas de BI (particularmente Tableau), bases de datos y herramientas de integración y transformación de datos (ETL).
  • Se valorará experiencia y conocimiento del entorno JD Edwards. y de los principios y mejores prácticas de calidad de datos.
  • Autonomía, iniciativa y proactividad para liderar proyectos y proponer mejoras de manera constante.
  • Capacidad de organización y meticulosidad, el cumplimiento de deadlines gestionando múltiples tareas de forma simultánea, así como una alta capacidad analítica.
  • Un mínimo de un 25% del tiempo el rol se ejercerá directamente en los negocios adquiridos, que pueden ser tanto nacionales como internacionales.

¿Por qué unirte a nuestro equipo?

  • Oportunidades para el crecimiento profesional dentro de un equipo internacional.
  • Plan de compensación flexible que incluye seguro de salud, guardería, transporte y comida, adaptado a tus necesidades. Además, incluye un seguro para tu mascota,
  • Acceso exclusivo a la plataforma Bakers Vip Club, con descuentos en ocio y consumo solo para nuestros colaboradores.
  • Subvención en el menú de cantina, para que disfrutes de la comida a un coste reducido.
  • Desayuno Europastry: ¡Empieza tu día con nuestros mejores productos!
  • Descuento exclusivo para empleados en nuestros productos de Europastry.
  • ¡Acceso a gimnasio y pistas de pádel del recinto para mantener tu bienestar físico!
  • Viernes tarde con horario intensivo.
  • Lockers disponibles en el edificio, donde puedes recibir tus pedidos en cualquier momento.

En Europastry, ofrecemos un espacio de trabajo diverso e inclusivo donde todas las personas se sientan valoradas y respetadas. Estamos comprometidos con prácticas de contratación justas y equitativas, implementamos programas de formación para asegurar que toda nuestra plantilla conozca y esté comprometida con estos principios.

Estamos interesados en el valor único que puedes aportar a nuestro equipo, independientemente de cualquier otro aspecto. Por favor, envía un CV que destaque tus logros profesionales y habilidades. No es necesario incluir fotografías ni datos personales que no sean relevantes para la evaluación de tu candidatura.

¿Te gustaría ser Baker?

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are growing our teams and this is an opportunity for you to join our Barcelona office as a Data Analyst within the Analytics Performance Marketing team.

You will collaborate closely with Data Analysts, Data Scientists besides UA Managers and other Marketing roles to analyse and interpret data that drives our marketing strategies.

Your insights will play a key role in shaping campaign optimization, identifying growth opportunities, and ultimately contributing to the company's success in a competitive gaming market.

As a Data Analyst you will have a key role in defining, extracting and actioning data from big and complex datasets from a variety of analytical solutions from simple to complex.

What You'll Do

Key Responsibilities:
Data Analysis & Reporting:
Gather, clean, and analyze marketing data from multiple sources to provide actionable insights.
Produce ad hoc analyses to support decision-making for campaigns and product launches.
Monitor and evaluate the performance of marketing campaigns ( paid ads, organic TV, brand) and provide recommendations for optimisation.
Develop actionable insights from user data that inform marketing targeting, acquisition and retention strategies.
Collaboration:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including Data Science, Data Engineer, to integrate marketing data with overall product and business objectives.
Communicate findings and insights to non-technical stakeholders through clear and concise visualizations and presentations.
Data Quality & Governance:
Ensure the accuracy and integrity of all marketing data through regular data audits and validation processes.
Help set and maintain data tracking standards across marketing channels, ensuring consistency and reliability.







What We're Looking For

Required Qualifications:
3 to 5 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar analytical role, preferably within the gaming / tech / financial industry.
Strong proficiency in data analysis tools (SQL, Python, Excel, etc.).
Experience with data modelling, time series analysis, A/B testing, Difference in Difference
Ability to identify trends, extract insights, and communicate findings in a clear and actionable manner.
Strong attention to detail and ability to work with large datasets.
Ability to present complex data in an easy-to-understand format to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Nice-to-Have Skills:
Familiarity with game-related metrics, mobile apps such as daily active users (DAU), in-app purchases (IAPs), and retention/engagement metrics.


Why Product Madness?

As part of the Aristocrat family, we share their mission of bringing joy to life through the power of play, with a world-class team who creates top-grossing, leading titles in the social casino genre, including Heart of Vegas, Lightning Link, Cashman Casino.

With 800 team members across the globe, Product Madness is headquartered in London, with offices in Barcelona, Gdańsk, Lviv, Montreal and a remote team spanning the USA, making us a truly global powerhouse.

We live by our People First principle. Regardless of where, when, or how they work, our team members have opportunities to elevate their careers, and grow alongside us. We take pride in fostering an inclusive culture, where our people are encouraged to be their very best, every day.

But don’t just take our word for it. In 2024, we made the Global Inspiring Workplace Awards list, and won a bronze award at the Stevies for Great Employers in the ‘Employer of the Year - Media and Entertainment’ category.

So, what’s stopping you?

Our Values
People First
We have the deepest respect for our people and their well being. We know they are exceptionally talented and will always have a choice. We want them to re-choose us every day. We are committed to building a culture where each person's voice will always be heard and addressed.
MAD for More
Always improving, innovating and never settling for the existing. We push all boundaries with courage and ambition to become the world’s best games company.
Champion Together We excel at what we do but yet remain humble and helpful to our teammates. We champion one another and hold each other to high standards without any egos.
Globally Inclusive
We are all Equal - regardless of the language we speak, where we live, our gender, religion or culture we come from. We want to build a global home, where everyone has the equal opportunity to make an impact.
Customer Focused
We always think from the customer's perspective - be it players or internal customers.

Improving their experience and joy is what drives us. Every client's success is our big win!

Travel Expectations

None

At this time, we are unable to sponsor work visas for this position. Candidates must be authorized to work in the job posting location for this position on a full-time basis without the need for current or future visa sponsorship.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join Proton and build a better internet where privacy is the default

At Proton, we believe that privacy is a fundamental human right and the cornerstone of democracy. Since our inception in 2014, founded by a team of scientists from CERN, we have dedicated ourselves to providing free and open-source technology to millions worldwide, ensuring access to privacy, security, and freedom online.

Our journey began with Proton Mail, the largest secure email service globally, and has since expanded to include Proton VPN, Proton Calendar, Proton Drive, and Proton Pass. These tools empower individuals and organizations to take control of their personal data, break away from Big Tech’s invasive practices, and defeat censorship. Our work impacts hundreds of millions of lives, from activists on the front lines defending freedom to leaders in governments protecting sensitive information. In some cases, Proton’s services have even been instrumental in saving lives by enabling secure and private communications in high-risk situations.

Proton is a profitable company that does not rely upon VC funding, supporting over 100 million user accounts with a growing team of over 500 people from over 50 different countries, from the world's top companies and universities. We value intelligence, learning potential, and ambition in our hiring process. Adaptability is key as we navigate uncharted territories and redefine how business is conducted online.

Hiring at Proton is highly selective, with less than 1% of candidates hired. We believe smaller teams of exceptional talent will always prevail over larger teams with lower talent density. You will have the opportunity work with many of the world's top minds in their fields, ranging from former international math and science olympiad winners to chess champions.

We have a global mindset and big ambitions but remain a start-up at heart. We value empowerment and flexibility and keep our structure flat to keep moving fast and avoid unnecessary politics. Tired of blending into the crowd? Join us and do work you can truly be proud of. Check our open-source projects here!

Purpose of the role

We are looking for a talented data analyst to help us support data-driven decision-making across the company. You will be embedded within a business unit (Mail, VPN, Drive, Growth, etc) and will play a key role in understanding our customers, guiding the team in their decision-making, and driving the implementation of new features and growth initiatives. As part of the data team, you will also collaborate with data science and data engineering in improving our data platform.

What You Will Do



Lead colleagues to the right decision by using data
Assemble, clean, and manage large, complex datasets from different data sources
Apply tools and techniques for data analysis and visualization
Represent and summarize data and findings in the most appropriate format
Research new use cases for already existing data, and provide feedback on new data sources to be incorporated
Share findings and best practices for your business unit with analysts in other business units



Job Requirements



Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitive (statistics, mathematics, physics, engineering, computer science, etc) or financial discipline.
Strong analytical skills
Experience in business intelligence, product analytics, marketing KPIs, or web analytics
at least 5 years of relevant working experience in the field
Advanced knowledge of SQL
Strong data visualization skills



Bonus points for:



Good knowledge of Python
Git knowledge
Open-minded, ready to test and implement new ideas



What We Offer



Office First: Collaboration is easier and more effective in person, which is why we have offices in Geneva, Zurich, Prague, Barcelona, Paris, London, Vilnius, Skopje, and Taipei. You can also enjoy working from home up to 30% of the time, while enjoying great company during our three core days in the office.
Technology: We provide all the devices and software you need to excel in your role, ensuring you have the best tools at your disposal to achieve your goals.
Food: Lunch and snacks are provided by Proton every day at our offices.
Transport: We will always support our employees with transport costs through subsidizing public transport, bike allowances, or parking spaces based on your office location.
Stock Options: At Proton, we are all owners of the company and you get stock options when you join us.
Flexible Working: You can define your own working hours as long as it works with team meetings.
Learning and Development: We are committed to your professional growth. Proton offers various learning opportunities, including training programs, conferences and events, and continual learning.
Employee Benefits: Comprehensive health insurance plans, competitive retirement savings options, generous vacation and leave policies, and wellness programs.
Work that Matters: Proton is a community-first organization, started with the support of a crowdfunding campaign and built with community input. To this day, Proton’s only source of revenue is user subscriptions. Over 100 million people trust and support Proton, and we put our users and community first in everything we do. Read more about our impact here.



Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

At Proton, we believe diversity drives innovation and strengthens our mission to provide privacy as a default for all. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where all individuals, regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, physical ability, or socio-economic background, feel valued and empowered. We strive to create equal opportunities, promote open dialogue, and support continuous learning to ensure every voice is heard and respected.

If you need any extra support or reasonable adjustments during the hiring process, please let your talent partner know.

Candidate Privacy Notice

When you apply for a position, refer a candidate, or are considered for a role at Proton Technologies AG (Proton, we, us, or our), your information is stored in Greenhouse, in accordance with their Service Privacy Policy. This information is used to evaluate your suitability for the posted position. We also retain this information for consideration for future roles that you may apply for or that we believe may align with your background and skills.

If we no longer have a legitimate business need to process your information, we will either delete or anonymize it. Should you have any inquiries about how we use or manage your information, or if you wish to access, correct, or delete your data, please contact our privacy team at careers@proton.ch.

Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from candidates. We will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from an unsolicited offer, even if the candidate is subsequently hired by Proton.

To learn more about our privacy policy, please visit our privacy policy page.

Title: Programa Formativo DATA Y BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE-Sabseg-
Description:
🚀 ¡PROGRAMA FORMATIVO DE DATA Y BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE! -SABSEG- 🚀

Si te apasiona la tecnología, los datos y el análisis, esta es tu oportunidad para dar el siguiente paso en tu carrera profesional.

🌟 MISIÓN DEL PUESTO:

Serás una pieza clave en el análisis y gestión de datos, apoyando en la creación de dashboards interactivos en Power BI y en la realización de consultas SQL en bases de datos. Tu rol te permitirá aprender de expertos en el área, desarrollar habilidades técnicas y obtener una visión completa del mundo de los datos, ¡todo mientras apoyas en la toma de decisiones estratégicas!

📌 FUNCIONES DEL PUESTO:


💻 Análisis y Gestión de Datos:
📊 Creación de Dashboards en Power BI
🧑‍💻 Consultas SQL
📈 Generación de Reportes y Análisis
⚙️ Automatización de Procesos



💡 ¿QUÉ OFRECEMOS


💰Prácticas remuneradas: es importante tener convenio con la universidad o fp.
🌱Aprendizaje constante: oportunidad para adquirir experiencia práctica.
👥 Mentoría y soporte: Recibirás la orientación de un equipo de expertos, que te guiará en tu desarrollo profesional.
🚀 Crecimiento: La oportunidad de crecer dentro de una empresa innovadora que valora el talento joven y fomenta el desarrollo profesional.



🔗 ¿Estás listo/a para dar el siguiente paso en tu carrera? ¡Inscríbete ahora y sé parte de nuestro equipo!

📲 Conoce más en sabseg.com/es/

Title: Master Data Analyst
Description:
CUSTOMER SERVICE MASTER DATA ANALYST Location: Barcelona, Spain

The Customer Service Master Data Analyst is responsible for ensuring the accuracy, completeness, and timeliness of master data processes within the market. This role plays a key part in maintaining high-quality master data execution and overseeing data execution from the Shared Service Center. The role is critical for driving efficiency in master data management and ensuring seamless customer service operations.

Your main focus:


Ensure Master Data Readiness & Quality: Deliver accurate and timely data setup KPIs for product activation, PIPO management, customer setup, logistics, and pricing conditions. Guarantee data readiness for new product launches and promotional activities. Train Sales and Marketing teams to follow global standards and ensure accurate input using standard templates.
Governance and Execution of Master Data Processes: Own and enforce master data execution processes, ensuring compliance with business standards. Develop protocols and workflows to maintain master data quality and implement continuous improvement practices.
Oversee Shared Service Center Operations: Monitor and validate the quality of master data execution by the Shared Service Center, ensuring SLA adherence.
Conduct quality control checks and provide feedback to improve processes and performance.
Data Insights and Analytics: Consolidate master data insights and share them with the Master Data Leader to support informed decision-making.


Working for Coty means constant opportunities and change. You will be managing a lot of things at the same time, but this is also what makes it exciting!

Key success measures for the Customer Services Master Data Analyst include the following:


Timeliness and Accuracy: Ensure master data updates are completed within SLA timeframes and accurately on the first attempt.
Process and Compliance: Adhere to SLAs, protocols, governance standards, and achieve high audit compliance rates.
Quality and Efficiency: Maintain high QC pass rates, resolve data issues quickly, and ensure data completeness in all entries.
Stakeholder Satisfaction and Reporting: Deliver timely analytics and reports while achieving strong feedback from internal stakeholders.


The Customer Services Master Data Analyst will liaise with various cross-functional and remote teams, such as:


Customer Service Operations
Shared Service Center
Master Data Global Teams
IT CoE


YOU ARE A COTY FIT

You have excellent problem solving skills and have the ability to think quickly & work under tight deadlines. As a CS Master Data Analyst, you get energy from working in a fast-paced, diverse, and challenging environment. You have strong attention to detail and organisation skills, and can communicate effectively and collaborate with various stakeholders.

Other than that, we are looking for candidates who:


Have a Bachelor’s degree, higher vocational training or vocational training in Data Management, or a related field.
2 to 4 years of experience in master data management, customer service, or related fields.
Proficiency in SAP and data governance tools.
Basic fluency/proficiency in English and proficient or native in any of the following languages: Spanish, French, Italian, Dutch, German
Strong proficiency in data analysis tools will be a plus (e.g., Excel, Power BI, Tableau).
Familiarity with customer and product master data processes in SAP (customer set up, activation, PIPO, pricing conditions).


Our Benefits

As our Customer Service Master Data Analyst, some of the benefits you will receive are:


Competitive remuneration and perks will be matched with your experience and knowledge.
Ticket restaurant (daily diet for meals)
Company products / Access to the company shop
Life and accident insurance


RECRUITMENT PROCESS


A screening call with the recruiters
A first online/in-person interview with hiring managers
A second interview (optionally)
Feedback, verbal offer
Hiring


About Coty

Coty is one of the world’s largest beauty companies with an iconic portfolio of brands across fragrance, color cosmetics, skincare, and body care. At Coty, we celebrate the entire human kaleidoscope and cultivate a culture of fearless kindness. Therefore, we are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. We do not discriminate against any candidate or employee and strive to be an open, inclusive and diverse workplace where all employees can be their authentic self. Join us in making over the world of beauty!

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Your mission

Your mission

Skills

We are looking for a highly motivated Marketing Data Analyst to join our Growth and Marketing team. In this role you will work closely with growth, marketing, product, and business teams to drive growth and optimize marketing efforts by delivering actionable insights through data analysis, and supporting data-driven decision-making. This will be a highly analytical role, that will require a mix of cross-collaboration, operations, creativity and strong communication skills. More specifically you will be responsible for the following:


Work with growth and marketing to identify opportunities to optimize always on activities and campaigns, and drive overall growth and marketing success.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key performance metrics (KPIs), and implement specific dashboards to support leadership.
Analyze data sets to identify patterns, trends, and insights to inform growth and marketing decisions.
Ability to translate complex data into clear and actionable insights for growth and marketing teams.
Work closely with growth, marketing, product and strategy to promote the implementation of conclusions and bring business-wide improvements.
Investigate and attribute data anomalies, build automated anomaly attribution tools.
Support Livo data foundations, ranging from data modeling to tooling to consume data across the organisation.
Contribute to building a data-driven culture within Livo.


Your profile

What We're Looking For


Bachelor's degree or above, majoring in statistics or data science is preferred.
At least 3+ years of experience in growth analytics, data analysis, or a similar role in a high-performance technology company
Strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and a commitment to delivering high-quality insights. Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL and Python.
Knowledge of modern data tools such as Airbyte, Fivetran, or equivanet.
Experience with data visualization tools like Metabase, Looker, or similar platforms.
Experience with A/B testing, experimentation, and statistical analysis.
Familiarity with cloud-based data storage and management services.
Strong spoken and written English and Spanish is a must. Other languages are nice to have.
Self-starter with the ability to thrive in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment.


Why us?

At Livo Health, we offer a unique opportunity to make a tangible impact in the healthcare space. You will play a pivotal role in scaling our operations, all while working alongside passionate individuals who are driven to make a difference.


High Growth: Work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment with countless opportunities for personal and professional development.
Competitive salary package: reflecting your experience and expertise, ensuring you are rewarded for your hard work and dedication
Meaningful equity package: We truly want team members to own a relevant part of the business as a key driver to fully buy into the equity story and the change we’re trying to promote in the world, with the corresponding economic upside that goes with it
Innovation: Be at the forefront of transforming healthcare staffing through technology and innovative operational processes.
Impact: Help solve one of healthcare’s most critical issues — healthcare professional talent crisis/shortage — and make a real-world impact on healthcare providers and patients alike.
Cool & vibrant Offices: Very well located offices at the heart of Barcelona in Paseo de Gracia with plenty of natural light, great views, spacious and cool vibes
Culture: Strong culture with an emphasis on ownership, impact, and ambition, coupled with the determination to build something meaningful whilst enjoying the journey
Benefits: We will soon rollout a benefits program in line with market standards


Interview Process

Our hiring process is designed to assess both your skills and cultural fit with our mission-driven team:


Call with HR: initial conversation to assess motivation, culture fit and salary expectations
45-minute interview with our VP of Growth, David
60-minute technical SQL & Programming call with Backend Engineer
45-minute Case Study with our VP of Growth and CEO
45-minute culture fit call with CTO


About Us

Livo was born with the mission to improve healthcare globally through cutting edge technology and that has always been our North Star since we deeply believe health is the most important asset we all have as individuals. We launched last year in Spain our nursing shift marketplace whose aim is to support health care institutions with their nurse staffing needs, by matching institutions with healthcare professionals that are interested in extra work, adding transparency, flexibility and convenience to both stakeholders and its traction has been outstanding. Our vision is to radically transform the way healthcare institutions hire, retain and manage talent nowadays whilst empowering healthcare staff with more tools, flexibility, money, and recognition.
Show more

Title: ? Inicio Inmediato Analista De Datos (Operaciones Y Logística)
Description:
Sobre Grupo Fire:Grupo Fire es un líder destacado en la industria de protección contra incendios en España, contando con más de 300 profesionales, una base de clientes que supera los 50,000, y operaciones en seis regiones.

Conocidos por nuestro compromiso con la seguridad y la calidad, estamos en constante expansión y evolución para satisfacer las necesidades de nuestros clientes y del mercado.Estamos creciendo y en 2025 seremos la principal compañía de protección contra incendios en España.Descripción del Puesto:Buscamos un Analista de Logística y Datos con conocimiento de logística y operaciones.

Este rol se centra en analizar y optimizar las operaciones logísticas y los flujos de trabajo para mejorar la entrega de servicios y la eficiencia operativa.

Tenemos la ambición de convertir al Grupo Fire en la compañía de servicios más eficiente de España-Responsabilidades Clave:- Realizar análisis detallados de los datos de producción, rutas logísticas y flujos de trabajo de los técnicos para identificar ineficiencias y áreas de mejora.- Utilizar análisis de causa raíz para proponer e implementar optimizaciones basadas en datos para los procesos logísticos y de ejecución de servicios.- Desarrollar y gestionar indicadores clave de rendimiento (KPIs) para medir y mejorar el rendimiento logístico y operacional.- Liderar e implementar proyectos de mejora continua utilizando metodologías como Lean, Six Sigma y Kaizen.- Actualizar y mantener procedimientos operativos estándar (SOPs) para asegurar la adherencia y cumplimiento consistentes de los procesos.- Educar y liderar equipos en prácticas de mejora continua, promoviendo una cultura de innovación y excelencia operativa.Calificaciones:- Título universitario en Ingeniería Industrial, Ingeniería de Procesos, Ciencia de Datos o un campo relacionado.- Al menos 3-5 años de experiencia en análisis de datos, mejora de procesos y logística, específicamente dentro de sectores orientados al servicio como protección contra incendios o industrias similares.- Capacidad demostrada en análisis estadístico, mapeo de procesos y modelado en excel.- Experiencia en Lean Manufacturing, Six Sigma y otras herramientas de mejora continua.- Fuertes habilidades de comunicación, capaces de presentar efectivamente datos e información para influir en la toma de decisiones.- Fluidez en español e inglés.Lo Que Ofrecemos:- Salario competitivo con compensación variable basada en el rendimiento.- Crecimiento acelerado; la empresa está duplicando de tamaño cada año.

Y los profesionales que sean un buen match crecerán de forma similar.- Un ambiente colaborativo con un equipo de alto calibre.- Oportunidades continuas de formación y desarrollo profesional.Proceso de Aplicación:Los candidatos interesados deben enviar su currículum y una carta de presentación explicando sus calificaciones e interés en el puesto a ******ón: Barcelona o Madrid, EspañaTipo de Contrato: Tiempo completo, IndefinidoFecha de Inicio: Inmediata

Title: Data Analyst, Retail Media
Description:
What You'll Do:

The Retail Media EMEA Analytics team, part of the rapidly expanding Criteo Retail Media business, leverages our grand set of shopper data to design and develop actionable insights for our Retailer and Brand clients. We bring the analytical perspective onto the business and provide recommendations based on high quality data analysis and strong understanding of our industry and products. We leverage our unique position to provide our commercial teams and clients with visibility into shopper behavior, market trends and product performance that can't be found anywhere else.

Criteo’s high-growth business model brings both opportunities and challenges. This position requires working with large sets of data and a variety of stakeholders to solve complex business problems by thinking strategically and proposing innovative solutions. The ideal candidate functions with minimal oversight and has the ability to learn new concepts quickly.


Mine massive data sets and turn them into understandable and actionable insights
Build scalable analytic solutions using state of the art tools of Criteo analytics stack (Hadoop, Vertica, PySpark…)
Develop innovative analytical approaches to measure Brands & Retailers’ performance from design to presentation of results, leveraging all our expertise in Data Science (statistical thinking, A/B testing, bootstrapping, data visualization…)
Frequently interact with other teams (R&D, product, commercial teams…) and clients to share data-driven recommendations and insights
Develop and maintain deep knowledge of Criteo Retail Media products and technologies as they evolve



Who You Are:

You are passionate about data and want to work with leading edge technologies in online industry:


You have at least 2 years’ experience in Data Science or Data Analytics
Master’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, etc.)
Fluency in the core toolkit of Data Science/Data Analytics: SQL is required, Python is a real asset (master most common data libraries: pandas, numpy…)
Outstanding analytical skills: passion for translating data-speak into relevant, compelling stories
A background in the digital industry or consulting is a plus
You have the combination of technical skills, passion for learning, and the soft skills to work with all personality types in a dynamic environment
You are fluent in English



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Analista de datos (M/H)
Description:
En Empresas IMAN, estamos en búsqueda de un/a Analista de Datos para formar parte del equipo de Servicios Centrales con sede en Terrassa.




Buscamos un profesional con experiencia en la creación de informes interactivos en Power BI y desarrollo de aplicaciones en PowerApps. Será responsable de transformar datos en información útil para la toma de decisiones, además de diseñar soluciones que optimicen procesos mediante herramientas de la Power Platform de Microsoft.




Funciones:

Desarrollo de Informes y Dashboards en Power BI.

Crear y mantener reportes interactivos que visualicen datos de forma clara.
Optimizar modelos de datos y aplicar fórmulas DAX para obtener métricas relevantes.




Desarrollo de Aplicaciones en PowerApps

Diseñar aplicaciones orientadas a la digitalización y automatización de procesos.
Integrar estas aplicaciones con diversas fuentes de datos y establecer flujos de trabajo eficientes mediante Power Automate.

Integración y Gestión de Datos

Consolidar información proveniente de bases de datos, APIs, archivos y otras fuentes.
Diseñar y optimizar procesos ETL para garantizar la integridad y precisión de los datos.
Gestionar y mejorar consultas SQL y almacenes de datos.




Calidad y Seguridad de la Información

Implementar controles para asegurar la calidad y seguridad de los datos.
Aplicar normativas y buenas prácticas en la gestión y protección de la información.




Colaboración con Equipos de Negocio

Trabajar conjuntamente con otros departamentos para identificar necesidades y traducirlas en soluciones de datos.
Presentar de forma clara los insights y recomendaciones a los distintos stakeholders.




Requisitos:

Experiencia comprobada en el desarrollo de informes en Power BI y aplicaciones en PowerApps.
Conocimientos en integración de datos, procesos ETL y optimización de consultas SQL.
Capacidad analítica, orientada a la solución de problemas y al trabajo en equipo.
Habilidad para comunicar hallazgos técnicos a audiencias no especializadas.
Residir en Terrassa o alrededores.
Valorable carné de conducir y disponibilidad de vehículo propio.




¿Qué ofrecemos?

Contratación indefinida. Posición estable.
Jornada completa de lunes a viernes de 9 a 18. Flexibilidad.
Salario a negociar según experiencia y expectativas.

HTML:
En Empresas IMAN, estamos en búsqueda de un/a Analista de Datos para formar parte del equipo de Servicios Centrales con sede en Terrassa.


Buscamos un profesional con experiencia en la creación de informes interactivos en Power BI y desarrollo de aplicaciones en PowerApps. Será responsable de transformar datos en información útil para la toma de decisiones, además de diseñar soluciones que optimicen procesos mediante herramientas de la Power Platform de Microsoft.


Funciones:

Desarrollo de Informes y Dashboards en Power BI.

  • Crear y mantener reportes interactivos que visualicen datos de forma clara.
  • Optimizar modelos de datos y aplicar fórmulas DAX para obtener métricas relevantes.


Desarrollo de Aplicaciones en PowerApps

  • Diseñar aplicaciones orientadas a la digitalización y automatización de procesos.
  • Integrar estas aplicaciones con diversas fuentes de datos y establecer flujos de trabajo eficientes mediante Power Automate.

Integración y Gestión de Datos

  • Consolidar información proveniente de bases de datos, APIs, archivos y otras fuentes.
  • Diseñar y optimizar procesos ETL para garantizar la integridad y precisión de los datos.
  • Gestionar y mejorar consultas SQL y almacenes de datos.


Calidad y Seguridad de la Información

  • Implementar controles para asegurar la calidad y seguridad de los datos.
  • Aplicar normativas y buenas prácticas en la gestión y protección de la información.


Colaboración con Equipos de Negocio

  • Trabajar conjuntamente con otros departamentos para identificar necesidades y traducirlas en soluciones de datos.
  • Presentar de forma clara los insights y recomendaciones a los distintos stakeholders.


Requisitos:

  • Experiencia comprobada en el desarrollo de informes en Power BI y aplicaciones en PowerApps.
  • Conocimientos en integración de datos, procesos ETL y optimización de consultas SQL.
  • Capacidad analítica, orientada a la solución de problemas y al trabajo en equipo.
  • Habilidad para comunicar hallazgos técnicos a audiencias no especializadas.
  • Residir en Terrassa o alrededores.
  • Valorable carné de conducir y disponibilidad de vehículo propio.


¿Qué ofrecemos?

  • Contratación indefinida. Posición estable.
  • Jornada completa de lunes a viernes de 9 a 18. Flexibilidad.
  • Salario a negociar según experiencia y expectativas.

Title: Data Analyst Senior
Description:
As a Data Analyst Senior, you are in charge of building SQL, Qlik and PowerBI data models to support key business decisions. You will collaborate with our product owners, guide your team members and work closely with our clients on their challenges requiring Data Foundations, Data Analytics, and Data Science.

As a Data Analyst Senior, you work closely with data engineers, bi analysts and product owners to create fast, efficient, and scalable data intelligence solutions for Werfen employees.




Key Accountabilities

Among others, you will:

• Between 2 to 3 years of experience in a similar role, managing a team or multiple projects. Preferably in the digital/tech and health/diagnostics/life science space.

•Work with the team and business stakeholders to identify requirements, define models, and kickstart new analytics initiatives.

•Build data models with SQL and automate them with Python. Have deep knowledge of all the datasets inside the data lake to be able to provide guidance to stakeholders.

•Apply the correct data models to the business problem at hand.

•Leverage creative solutions, analytics, and visualization/ reporting techniques to enhance knowledge and drive actionable insights that deliver ROI.







Networking/Key relationships

Critical to be able to build relationships based in trust within the organization as the function is to respond to the internal customer needs while taking into consideration the overall corporate strategy.




Minimum Knowledge & Experience required for the position:

We expect that you have experience with:

• SQL advanced

• Good knowledge of any programming language like Python

• Power BI, Qlik or other dashboarding software

• Statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular libraries and tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.




We will consider it an advantage if you also have familiarity with any of the following:

• AWS

• Microsoft Azure cloud computing

• Familiarity with DataOps principles

• Familiar with Agile methodologies

• Git software versioning




Skills & Capabilities: We expect you to demonstrate proficiency in data analysis and have a keen interest in understanding various business domains. We will also need you to be able to communicate data concepts to non-technical colleagues.

• You are fluent in English both orally and in writing.

• You have good presentation skills.

• You can communicate well within the team and with stakeholders.

• You can analyze business requirements in dialogue with internal stakeholders.

• You can collaborate directly with external consultants and vendors.

• You are a team player willing to share knowledge, ideas, and banter.




Travel requirements: 5% of time

Title: Data Quality Analyst
Description:
In November of 2024, Printful and Printify came together as two equals and merged to form a global on-demand powerhouse. This role will involve working across our two platforms and brands, a unique and special challenge. To learn more about the merger, check out our blog post.

About The Role

Join us as a Data Quality Analyst, where your meticulous attention to finance data ensures the availability, completeness, and accuracy of essential information. Your primary focus will be on establishing efficient data retrieval processes and ensuring the highest quality of source data. You will be responsible for gathering all relevant financial data, ensuring its accuracy and prompt availability. A key part of your role will be developing and maintaining a robust data quality monitoring system, and conducting business tests to identify and resolve any issues.

Your Daily Tasks will Entail:


Maintain the accuracy of finance data in the data warehouse by developing and maintaining a robust data quality monitoring system, driving the resolution of identified errors
Collaborate with data engineers and business stakeholders to improve data pipelines
Develop source data tables for finance reporting needs and design scalable data models that facilitate accurate and insightful decision-making
Drive company-wide data accessibility by advocating for self-service data usage and utilizing BI tools such as Looker to empower teams with actionable insights
Keep processes organized and well-documented, contributing to process improvements and ensuring efficiency, particularly during month-end closing activities
Foster cross-functional collaboration by ensuring effective communication and alignment between finance and data teams, supporting seamless integration and cooperation



Your Qualifications:


At least 3 years of experience as a Business Intelligence Developer/Data Analyst
At least 2 years of experience building and enhancing Looker applications and administration
Well-versed in Python and SQL coding
Skills in data modeling and business logic processes
Experience with DWH design
Analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail
Able to work in a highly collaborative environment
Proactive attitude and ability to work independently, taking ownership of projects and delivering high-quality results within deadlines
Able to demonstrate knowledge of dimensional modeling, and data visualization techniques



What we Offer:


All the resources and tools to perform your tasks (choose between Mac or Windows)
An opportunity to work remotely or in a modern and welcoming office in Rīga
Flexible working hours (start your day as late as 11 a.m.)
Health insurance, including a mental wellness program
Employee discounts for 300+ premium products
Room for professional growth (conferences, workshops, mentoring, guest lectures)
Exciting team-building events and parties you’ll never forget!



We are an equal opportunity workplace. We’re committed to diversity and inclusion and make our hiring decisions based solely on qualifications, merit, and work experience.

Interested, but don’t think this is the right fit for you? Feel free to share it with friends and check out other open positions at our career's site. We’re always looking for creative and driven minds to join our ever-growing team.
Show more
