Title: Talent Data & Automation Analyst
Description:
⚡Do you dare to lead the digital transformation to create a more sustainable world? 🌳

At Schneider Electric, we are the leading digital partner in sustainability and efficiency for businesses, communities, and individuals. Our goal is for all people to be able to make the most of our energy and resources through the integration of processes, software, big data, and energy technologies that enable integrated management of buildings, industries, and cities. We are present in over 110 countries with a diverse and disruptive team of over 150,000 people. If you are seeking an opportunity to propel your career and challenge your creativity, we want to meet you!

Schneider Digital is the digital department of Schneider Electric, leading the digital transformation in the company by giving support globally to our internal teams and our clients. Schneider Digital consists of 6 Digital Hubs worldwide which are strategically located to ensure a 24/7 support across the company (France, China, India, USA, Mexico and Spain). Our Digital Hub in Barcelona is formed by +450 employees working in strategic projects and different roles such as Data, Cybersecurity, ERP, Cloud, Infrastructures, IT Project Management or Digital Marketing.

We are looking for a Senior, Talent Management Data & Automation Analyst to join our dynamic Human Resources global Digital team in Barcelona.

What will you do?

In this role you’ll have 2 key missions:

Data: Turn raw data into useful insights that help the Schneider Digital Human Resources team to take people decisions, e.g. individuals future such as promotion, development, succession, and/or designing global programs to accelerate upskilling, readiness, etc. Your technical specialized skills mixed with HR domain expertise will help you find patterns, predict changes, and suggest data-driven solutions for business questions.
Automation: Simplify and automate all talent management process driving efficiency and seamless employee experience

Main responsibilities:

Ensure data quality, timely feed, maintenance, and communication/training to users on the suit of dashboards we have related to Talent Management (includes Tableau and Oracle)
Simplification & automation of talent management flow for day-to-day operations or program deployments
Support Global HRBPs on having handy, up-to-date data in a one stop shop according to needs
Leveraging the power of data talent management blind spots and proposing innovative talent solutions
Driving program deployments facing managers, HRBPs and employees

What qualifications will make you successful for this role?

Education: Degree or master’s in Data Management, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
Experience: 2-4 years of experience in a similar role
Experienced in data analysis, data process, and data management. Data visualization tools and power automate flows.
Ability to audit, clean and process data. Build data models & map use cases. Interpret and display data using different approaches and data visualization tools. Build key insights that lead to better informed and successful decision-making.
Good knowledge of Tableau, Power Automate, Phyton, R or other statistical programming languages
Oracle Human Resources / Analytics, ThoughtSpot or similar
Experience in Human Resources is a plus
Microsoft Office suite
Languages: Fluent in English (written and spoken)

Soft Skills:

Comfortable in multicultural environment
Able to translate technical solutions and problems for non-technical audiences
Continuous learning and curiosity
Autonomous, efficient and results driven
Organized and high attention to details and data accuracy
Manages sensitive and confidential information

What will you get?

We adapt to you:

🕓 With our flexible schedule, you'll have the freedom to adjust your work hours to accommodate your personal needs and responsibilities.

💻 We know how great it is to work from home. With our hybrid work plan, you can enjoy working from the comfort of your home.

🏝 Need more time to relax and disconnect? With our Holy Pack, you can purchase additional vacation days to recharge when you need it most.

📅 Celebrate holidays your way! With Floating Holidays, you can exchange holidays for other days that better suit your plans and personal preferences.

🧘Need additional time to explore new experiences or focus on personal projects? With the Sabbatical Pack, you can request up to 2 months of extra leave (unpaid).

💞 We value the importance of family and want to support you in all aspects of your life. Our Global Family Leave Policy provides flexible paid conditions for when you need it most, whether you're about to be a parent, need time to overcome a loss, or to care for a loved one.

We take care of you:

📱 With access to the health and wellness platform Wellwo, you and up to 5 people of your choice can enjoy access to wellness content, nutrition counseling, fitness classes, and more!

🏄From dance classes to booking a hotel spa, we offer an agreement with Wellhub so you can access a network of thousands of gyms and sports centers to keep your body active in the way you like best.

🩺 Your well-being is our priority. You will have medical service at your workplace for close attention to any medical needs.

We empower you:

🎯 With Open Talent Market, our AI-driven professional development platform, you can connect with job opportunities, projects, and mentors at Schneider Electric globally.

🤑 We offer you the opportunity to be a shareholder of Schneider Electric and share in our achievements with our stock ownership program.

🙌 We celebrate everyone's talent and success with our recognition program, through which you can give and receive points for your achievements and redeem them for gift cards at your favorite stores.

💗 You will have life insurance for your protection.

💰 We offer you a Flexible Remuneration Plan in which you can choose from a variety of options, such as health insurance, meal vouchers, childcare vouchers, transportation vouchers, training, and more.

🎁 With Club Schneider, you will enjoy special discounts at your favorite stores, restaurants, travel agencies, and other external services.

💚 Participate in company-subsidized volunteer programs to contribute to our community and have a positive impact on your environment.




DIGDATA24

Looking to make an IMPACT with your career?

When you are thinking about joining a new team, culture matters. At Schneider Electric, our values and behaviors are the foundation for creating a great culture to support business success. We believe that our IMPACT values - Inclusion, Mastery, Purpose, Action, Curiosity, Teamwork - starts with us.

IMPACT is also your invitation to join Schneider Electric where you can contribute to turning sustainability ambition into actions, no matter what role you play. It is a call to connect your career with the ambition of achieving a more resilient, efficient, and sustainable world.

We are looking for IMPACT Makers; exceptional people who turn sustainability ambitions into actions at the intersection of automation, electrification, and digitization. We celebrate IMPACT Makers and believe everyone has the potential to be one.

Become an IMPACT Maker with Schneider Electric - apply today!

€36 billion global revenue

+13% organic growth

150 000+ employees in 100+ countries

#1 on the Global 100 World’s most sustainable corporations

You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled.

Schneider Electric aspires to be the most inclusive and caring company in the world, by providing equitable opportunities to everyone, everywhere, and ensuring all employees feel uniquely valued and safe to contribute their best. We mirror the diversity of the communities in which we operate, and ‘inclusion’ is one of our core values. We believe our differences make us stronger as a company and as individuals and we are committed to championing inclusivity in everything we do.

At Schneider Electric, we uphold the highest standards of ethics and compliance, and we believe that trust is a foundational value. Our Trust Charter is our Code of Conduct and demonstrates our commitment to ethics, safety, sustainability, quality and cybersecurity, underpinning every aspect of our business and our willingness to behave and respond respectfully and in good faith to all our stakeholders. You can find out more about our Trust Charter here

Schneider Electric is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is our policy to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Position Summary

The Business Unit Printing & Converting (BUPC) is looking for a Data Analyst.

Your main mission will be to translate data into valuable information and actionable recommendations for the business. This global position will be a key enabler for the BU in the achievement of our 2025 profitability.

You will be a key member of the BUPC Finance team with the role to manage and enhance our reporting capabilities while working closely with the Data Engineering team. This role involves gathering business requirements, developing insightful reports, and ensuring data accuracy and consistency across various dashboards. The ideal candidate will be proficient in analytics tools and have a deep understanding of business needs.

The BU Printing & Converting includes 11 Manufacturing sites in a context of a new ERP harmonization across all entities, and covers the following main streams Finance & Controlling, Operations, Sales & Marketing, R&D.

Main Responsibilities

Report Development:


Design, develop, reports and dashboards
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and reliability
Translate complex data into actionable insights for business stakeholders.
Work closely with business teams to understand reporting requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
Plan data source acquisition ahead with data engineers to deliver reports in a timely manner
Propose and maintain UX / UI best practices


Continuous Improvement & Documentation:


Document reporting processes, methodologies, and data definitions.
Recommend improvements to reporting tools and workflows to enhance efficiency.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in analytics and visualization.


Data Quality & Validation:


Identify and escalate data inconsistencies or anomalies to the data engineering team.


Support the Finance team’s evolution from basic reporting to new state of the art business intelligence tools

Accompany users to change

Process changes and corrective maintenance

Support IT Data & Analytics operating model

Create Data Analytics key users’ community within the BU

Professional Experience

You have a Bachelor Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, or a related field.

3+ years of experience in data analysis, reporting, and visualization.

Proficiency in BI tools such as Tableau® (certification), Power BI, and Excel.

Knowledge of SAP HANA, Anaplan / OneStream is a plus

Experience working with large datasets and data warehouses.

Personal Attributes

Innovative spirit and interest in company processes

Solution oriented mindset

Drive to continuously improve your area

High sense of responsibility and independent working practice, showing initiative and high level of reliability

Great data visualization skills by presenting analytical findings in a clear and concise manner

Adaptable to work to both technical and non-technical audiences

Team player with good communication skills

Excellent level in English (French is a plus)

For more than 130 years, and over 50 countries, BOBST has always been at the forefront of innovation and we want to accelerate connectivity, digitalization, automation and sustainability to make packaging better than ever.

BOBST is one of the world’s leading suppliers of equipment and services to packaging and label manufacturers in the folding carton, corrugated board and flexible materials industries. Join our highly qualified staff and together, let’s shape the future of the packaging world.
Show more
HTML:
Position Summary

The Business Unit Printing & Converting (BUPC) is looking for a Data Analyst.

Your main mission will be to translate data into valuable information and actionable recommendations for the business. This global position will be a key enabler for the BU in the achievement of our 2025 profitability.

You will be a key member of the BUPC Finance team with the role to manage and enhance our reporting capabilities while working closely with the Data Engineering team. This role involves gathering business requirements, developing insightful reports, and ensuring data accuracy and consistency across various dashboards. The ideal candidate will be proficient in analytics tools and have a deep understanding of business needs.

The BU Printing & Converting includes 11 Manufacturing sites in a context of a new ERP harmonization across all entities, and covers the following main streams Finance & Controlling, Operations, Sales & Marketing, R&D.

Main Responsibilities

Report Development:

  • Design, develop, reports and dashboards
  • Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and reliability
  • Translate complex data into actionable insights for business stakeholders.
  • Work closely with business teams to understand reporting requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
  • Plan data source acquisition ahead with data engineers to deliver reports in a timely manner
  • Propose and maintain UX / UI best practices

Continuous Improvement & Documentation:

  • Document reporting processes, methodologies, and data definitions.
  • Recommend improvements to reporting tools and workflows to enhance efficiency.
  • Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in analytics and visualization.

Data Quality & Validation:

  • Identify and escalate data inconsistencies or anomalies to the data engineering team.

Support the Finance team’s evolution from basic reporting to new state of the art business intelligence tools

Accompany users to change

Process changes and corrective maintenance

Support IT Data & Analytics operating model

Create Data Analytics key users’ community within the BU

Professional Experience

You have a Bachelor Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, or a related field.

3+ years of experience in data analysis, reporting, and visualization.

Proficiency in BI tools such as Tableau® (certification), Power BI, and Excel.

Knowledge of SAP HANA, Anaplan / OneStream is a plus

Experience working with large datasets and data warehouses.

Personal Attributes

Innovative spirit and interest in company processes

Solution oriented mindset

Drive to continuously improve your area

High sense of responsibility and independent working practice, showing initiative and high level of reliability

Great data visualization skills by presenting analytical findings in a clear and concise manner

Adaptable to work to both technical and non-technical audiences

Team player with good communication skills

Excellent level in English (French is a plus)

For more than 130 years, and over 50 countries, BOBST has always been at the forefront of innovation and we want to accelerate connectivity, digitalization, automation and sustainability to make packaging better than ever.

BOBST is one of the world’s leading suppliers of equipment and services to packaging and label manufacturers in the folding carton, corrugated board and flexible materials industries. Join our highly qualified staff and together, let’s shape the future of the packaging world.

Title: BI Analyst
Description:
Hybrid -
Barcelona, Spain
Analytics
Permanent - Full Time

Job ID: r19179

What You'll Do


Proactively identify and collect analytical, tooling and reporting needs from different stakeholders – Commercial teams, Sales Operations, FP&A, Sales Compensation etc.
Develop and maintain self-service automated reporting in support of Commercial teams, Sales Operations and Finance teams using Power BI, Python or any other relevant technologies
Work collaboratively with the IIT Team to continuously improve the dataflows, reporting back end etc. as well as to improve the customer experience (UX/UI), in order to maximize the reporting outputs
Stay up to date with the latest BI tools and technologies, and make recommendations for new tools and approaches that could improve our BI capabilities
Monitor and maintain current reporting processes & data integrity that are relying on data from different systems and platforms
Incorporate feature requests or new tools into product roadmap based on leadership / end users business needs in order to optimize sales processes
Provide support on a daily basis to end users on any issues/blockers they might face and fix any bugs according to our SOPs
Coordinate trainings to end users on new reporting tools, processes and best practices
Develop strong project management skills to support our growth and organizational changes


Who You Are


2-3 years of experience working within BI or/and Data analytics
Bachelor’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Economics, Engineering, Computer Science etc.) or in Business, Finance with equivalent practical experience
SQL proficiency is required
Extensive previous working with Power BI
Background in any of the following is a plus: Python, Tableau, Databricks, Vertica, Hive/Hadoop, MS SQL Studio
Keen intellectual curiosity and ability to structure & solve complex problems in an autonomous way
Exceptional attention to detail coupled with an ability to see the bigger picture
Thorough conceptual and practical understanding of relational databases, data architecture/governance, and real-world application of statistical concepts
Combining technical skills, passion for learning and the ability to interact with a diverse group of stakeholders in a dynamic environment
Excellent communication skills in English


We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: RISK/DATA ANALYST ANÁLISIS SECTORIAL Y SEGUIMIENTO DE GRANDES RIESGOS
Description:
Descripción del puesto: ¿Qué proyectos desarrollamos?

 

El departamento de seguimiento de grandes riesgos tiene como principales proyectos y funciones:

 

Análisis de carteras específicas, tanto a nivel cuantitativo como cualitativo, y realizar presentaciones a alto nivel y a órganos supervisores.
es).
Análisis y seguimiento sectorial.
Elaboración información mensual para establecer el perímetro de seguimiento de los grupos/empresas de grandes riesgos, así como, asignar su prioridad.
Extracción de información de triggers para la gestión proactiva de los mismos y seguimiento de acreditados individualmente significativos (Single Nam
Proporcionar información para la previsión escenarios de NPLs para perímetro análisis individual.
Participación en procesos de inspecciones supervisoras. 
Gestión de auditorías externa e interna vinculadas al ámbito de análisis individualizado.
Evaluación y gestión proactiva de cambios regulatorios. Análisis de impacto en la cartera crediticia y colaboración en la implantación de procesos que contribuyan al cumplimiento normativo. 
Dar respuesta a peticiones del supervisor referente a información relacionada con el seguimiento de grandes acreditados.
Seguimiento proyectos con sistemas de información para el mantenimiento, mejoras y desarrollo de nuevos proyectos relacionados con el seguimiento de grandes acreditados, grupos económicos, portfolios y sectores.
Descripción del perfil:

 

Requisitos mínimos

 

Titulación superior en matemáticas, ingeniería informática o ciencias económicas/empresariales.  Se valorará MBA, FRM o similares.
Inglés hablado y escrito
Se valorará experiencia profesional en el ámbito de Riesgos.
Compromiso con la formación y el desarrollo profesional. 
Capacidad de análisis, rigor y síntesis. 
Espíritu crítico, visión global y estratégica del cliente. 
Entusiasmo, compromiso e implicación en el trabajo. 
Capacidad de trabajo en equipo con habilidades de relación interpersonal.

 

Competencias clave

 

Dominio Office: Excel y power point.
Se valorará muy positivamente el uso de herramienta extracción de datos (SAS Enterprise Guide) y conocimientos en Qlik sense.
Conocimientos del ámbito de riesgos y habilidades técnicas para poder entender y gestionar las necesidades asociadas al análisis de carteras de grandes riesgos, así cómo, buen manejo de los datos asociados para llevar a cabo dichos análisis y elaborar presentaciones a alto nivel y a órganos supervisores.
Ofrecemos:

  

Formar parte del Banco más innovador en Europa Occidental 2021 según los premios The Innovators de la revista estadounidense Global Finance.
Desarrollar una carrera profesional interna.
Programa de onboarding y seguimiento de desarrollo profesional, con evaluaciones individuales.
Programa de desarrollo formativo individualizado. Acceso a nuestra plataforma online de formación con un amplio catálogo autoformativo, para que tu aprendizaje sea continúo.
Atractivo paquete de beneficios sociales: seguro de salud, plan de pensiones, ayuda de estudios y condiciones financieras preferentes.
Retribución flexible aplicada a transporte, formación, idiomas, entre otros.
Medidas de flexibilidad

Title: Game Data Analyst
Description:
Ready for your next adventure?

We are Socialpoint, a world-renowned mobile game studio based in sunny Barcelona. Our games consistently rank among the top on iOS and Android, enjoyed by millions of players worldwide. As proud members of the Take-Two Interactive and Zynga family, our mission is simple: to create amazing gaming experiences and bring fun to everyone!

We’re looking for a Game Data Analyst to join our Analytics team. In this role, you'll analyze player behavior, collaborate with game teams, and help improve our games by driving retention and user conversion.

Using quantitative analysis, data science, statistics, and programming, you’ll generate insights that make a real impact at Socialpoint. To succeed, you’ll need to learn quickly, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and work closely with both analytics and game teams.

What will you do in Socialpoint?


Work with the game development teams to provide insights into user behavior and answer key business questions, turning our vast amount of data into actionable insights and transferable learnings.
Visualize and communicate the results of your analysis to senior stakeholders, making data driven recommendations that support key decisions.
Design and analyze A/B tests and other causal impact analysis to assess the impact of new features and changes.
Continuously educate stakeholders on data literacy and analytics best practices, to ensure they are empowered and autonomous to run analytically correct analysis.
Occasionally participate in advanced analytics projects, teaming up with other game data scientists & analysts to develop data tools and products.


Requirements


2-3 years experience applying analytics to answer business questions and mine for insights that drive value.
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis.
Experience with A/B testing.
Strong analytical skills in applied statistics. Prior experience with bayesian statistics is a plus.
Experienced creating dashboards and visualizing findings with a front-end visualization tool like Tableau or Looker.
A fast learner, highly meticulous and proactive individual.
Pragmatic, you know how to balance short term and long term deliverables.
A team player, you establish effective relationships to work with others for the win.


What's in it for you as a Socialpointer?


Hybrid working model from home and office. What does this mean? You need to live within commuting distance of our Barcelona office to attend important meetings and events.
Relocation support to help you move to Barcelona, if you're not already here.
An impressive 25 days of annual leave, not including public holidays.
An additional 5 days of annual leave during Christmas.
Full Catering for Breakfast and lunch at the office
Private medical insurance for you and your family to keep your health bar full.
Choose from the latest iOS or Android device upon joining (phone or tablet).
Free language lessons in English and Spanish.
Spotify Premium to add a special soundtrack to your adventure.
Legendary social events and parties to let off some steam.
Personal development is key for us: enjoy a significant budget to enhance your skills and knowledge, providing real growth opportunities!


What We Offer You:

Coming to work in the office? Don’t worry – we have you covered. Check out some of our onsite benefits:


Gym Facilities: Want to stay in shape? We have state-of-the-art gym facilities so you can level up your build stats.
New Office: Enjoy our brand-new office, complete with top-tier amenities, including a professional barista and delicious breakfast options.
Onsite Physiotherapist: Book an appointment with our onsite physiotherapist for any aches and pains.
Onsite Hairdressers: Drop by our onsite hairdressers for a trim (and forget your wallet; it's a Guild perk).


The list just goes on & on... so get your game on and apply now! Click “apply” to level up and submit your application in English.

Diversity & Conclusion Statement

We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, which means we are committed to creating and celebrating diverse thoughts, cultures, and backgrounds throughout our organization. Employment with us is based on substantive ability, objective qualifications, and work ethic – not an individual’s race, creed, color, religion, sex or gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin or ancestry, alienage or citizenship status, physical or mental disability, pregnancy, age, genetic information, veteran status, marital status, status as a victim of domestic violence or sex offenses, reproductive health decision, or any other characteristics protected by applicable law.

As an equal opportunity employer, we are committed to providing the necessary support and accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities, health conditions, or impairments (subject to any local qualifying requirements) to ensure their full participation in the job application or interview process. Please contact us at recruitment@socialpoint.es to request any accommodations or for support related to your application for an open position.

Please be aware that Socialpoint does not conduct job interviews or make job offers over third-party messaging apps such as Telegram, WhatsApp, or others. Socialpoint also does not engage in any financial exchanges during the recruitment or onboarding process, and will never ask a candidate for their personal or financial information over an app or other unofficial chat channel. Any attempt to do so may be the result of a scamp or phishing attack, and you should not engage. Socialpoint’s in-house recruitment team will only contact individuals through their official Company email addresses (i.e., via a zynga.com, naturalmotion.com, smallgiantgames.com, themavens.com, gram.gs email domain).

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a data enthusiast ready to make an impact? Join our team as a Data Analyst, where you’ll play a pivotal role in shaping our company’s future through sharp analysis, strategic insight, and proactive collaboration.

Key Responsibilities

Insight Generation & Analytics


Answer business questions using a wide range of data techniques.
Develop concise one-page documents with actionable insights and business recommendations.
Conduct in-depth analyses to solve key business problems.
Translate complex data into clear and concise presentations for senior management and stakeholders, effectively communicating key findings and recommendations.
Create compelling visualizations to effectively communicate key metrics to stakeholders.


Machine Learning & AI


Develop and deploy machine learning models to solve and automate key business problems and processes.
Foster an AI-driven culture within Holaluz by researching and disseminating AI knowledge across the company.
Stay up to date with emerging technologies and assess their suitability for Holaluz.


Data Warehousing


Populate the Data Warehouse with datasets using Python and SQL to create robust data pipelines.
Optimize and evolve the data warehousing infrastructure to ensure cost-effectiveness and scalability.
Maintain the smooth and efficient operation of Data Analytics systems.


What We’re Looking For

Education & Experience


A Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Telecommunications, or a related field
3–5 years of experience working as a Data Analyst, Data Scientist or Data Engineer.


Key Skills & Attributes


Expertise in SQL and Python language.
Analytical and strategic thinking with a proven ability to solve complex problems.
Good communication skills to distill intricate concepts into actionable insights.
Previous experience working with a visualization tool such as Power BI, QlikView, Tableau, etc.
A proactive, detail-oriented professional with a solution-focused mindset.
Team player who thrives both independently and in collaborative environments.
A positive, energetic attitude that aligns with our SHAKE culture:


○ Say things as they are

○ Have fun

○ Always people first

○ Keep rowing together

○ Es posible

Why Join Us?

This role is more than just a job—it’s an opportunity to drive meaningful impact within a fast-paced, forward-thinking organization. If you’re optimistic, hardworking, and excited to grow within a culture of transparency, collaboration, and possibility, we’d love to hear from you.
Show more

  • Conduct in-depth analyses to solve key business problems.
  • Translate complex data into clear and concise presentations for senior management and stakeholders, effectively communicating key findings and recommendations.
  • Create compelling visualizations to effectively communicate key metrics to stakeholders.

Machine Learning & AI

  • Develop and deploy machine learning models to solve and automate key business problems and processes.
  • Foster an AI-driven culture within Holaluz by researching and disseminating AI knowledge across the company.
  • Stay up to date with emerging technologies and assess their suitability for Holaluz.

Data Warehousing

  • Populate the Data Warehouse with datasets using Python and SQL to create robust data pipelines.
  • Optimize and evolve the data warehousing infrastructure to ensure cost-effectiveness and scalability.
  • Maintain the smooth and efficient operation of Data Analytics systems.

What We’re Looking For

Education & Experience

  • A Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Telecommunications, or a related field
  • 3–5 years of experience working as a Data Analyst, Data Scientist or Data Engineer.

Key Skills & Attributes

  • Expertise in SQL and Python language.
  • Analytical and strategic thinking with a proven ability to solve complex problems.
  • Good communication skills to distill intricate concepts into actionable insights.
  • Previous experience working with a visualization tool such as Power BI, QlikView, Tableau, etc.
  • A proactive, detail-oriented professional with a solution-focused mindset.
  • Team player who thrives both independently and in collaborative environments.
  • A positive, energetic attitude that aligns with our SHAKE culture:

○ Say things as they are

○ Have fun

○ Always people first

○ Keep rowing together

○ Es posible

Why Join Us?

This role is more than just a job—it’s an opportunity to drive meaningful impact within a fast-paced, forward-thinking organization. If you’re optimistic, hardworking, and excited to grow within a culture of transparency, collaboration, and possibility, we’d love to hear from you.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analysts at Thoughtworks collect, process and analyze large datasets to provide valuable insights and support informed decision-making for our clients. They are responsible for the strategy, implementation, productionization and articulation of business impact. They collaborate with cross-functional teams and communicate findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. They stay up-to-date with industry advancements, ensure data quality and security, and actively mentor other Thoughtworkers, fostering a culture of continuous learning and professional development.

Job responsibilities


You will perform data extraction and modeling to generate insights and make recommendations for the business.
You will support the definition and construction of KPIs that best represent the business performance of our clients, assisting in decision-making processes.
You will work on the development and maintenance of strategic dashboards, reports and KPIs.
You will use storytelling practices for effective dashboard construction.
You will build solutions and validate hypotheses through comprehensive data analysis.
You will design, conduct and measure both qualitative and quantitative research.
You will create proposals and conduct A/B tests.
You will conduct ad-hoc studies as needed.
You will connect with stakeholders to understand database structures, apply necessary business rules and share analysis methods and methodologies.



Job Qualifications

Technical Skills


You have expertise with Tableau as a self-service BI tool.
You have experience in analytics and business intelligence projects.
You have proficiency in Excel or Google Sheets.
You have strong data visualization practices with relevant tools.
You have proficiency in database management, either relational or non-relational.
You have advanced knowledge in SQL and Python.
You have ability to clean, prepare and analyze big data, both structured and unstructured.
You have exploratory, qualitative and quantitative analysis skills.
You have experience with research techniques and satisfaction indicators.
You have ability to identify patterns, actionable insights and relationships in data.



Professional Skills


You have great stakeholder management skills and you are able to build rapport and gain buy-in from clients and key stakeholders.
You are a great problem solver, thrive in ambiguity, tackle challenges from various angles and embrace risk management.
You have a data-driven approach, seeking opportunities to leverage data for efficiency and value, and actively collaborate to drive data-based decisions.
You are a great communicator and have the ability to present findings to technical and non-technical audiences.
You are a team player and actively collaborate with colleagues and other teams.
You are eager to coach, mentor and motivate others and you aspire to influence teammates to take positive action and accountability for their work.
English and Spanish communication and relationship building skills – written, verbal, facilitation, etc, are a must.



Other things to know

Learning & Development

There is no one-size-fits-all career path at Thoughtworks: however you want to develop your career is entirely up to you. But we also balance autonomy with the strength of our cultivation culture. This means your career is supported by interactive tools, numerous development programs and teammates who want to help you grow. We see value in helping each other be our best and that extends to empowering our employees in their career journeys.

About Thoughtworks

Thoughtworks is a dynamic and inclusive community of bright and supportive colleagues who are revolutionizing tech. As a leading technology consultancy, we’re pushing boundaries through our purposeful and impactful work. For 30+ years, we’ve delivered extraordinary impact together with our clients by helping them solve complex business problems with technology as the differentiator. Bring your brilliant expertise and commitment for continuous learning to Thoughtworks. Together, let’s be extraordinary.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Job Summary

In this role, you will work closely with a Senior Marketing Data Analyst to source, analyze, and visualize data from various internal teams and systems. You will transform complex datasets into easy-to-understand, actionable insights, helping our marketing team and executives make informed decisions. Your role will include collaboration with multiple teams and the ability to explain data trends, limitations, and strategic implications effectively.

Key Responsibilities

Data Sourcing & Integration:


Interface with cross-functional teams, including Measurement, Insights & Data Science, MAP market share and Category teams, Finance, Media, Customer Experience, and others, to gather relevant data.
Combine and harmonize data from multiple sources to create comprehensive datasets for analysis.


Data Analysis & Insight Generation


Conduct thorough analyses to detect and interpret trends and patterns, with a focus on deriving actionable insights from performance metrics, competitive intelligence, and evolving market trends.
Transform these insights into strategic recommendations to propel forward our marketing strategies and adapt to competitive pressures and market dynamics.


Visualization & Reporting


Develop and refine visualizations, dashboards, and comprehensive reports that clearly articulate complex data sets. Ensure these tools not only convey information effectively but also facilitate strategic decision-making, thereby enhancing marketing initiatives and business results.


Stakeholder Communication


Clearly articulate data findings, limitations, and implications to non-technical stakeholders, including marketing teams and executive leadership.
Assist the Senior Data Analyst in preparing and delivering presentations to internal teams and executives.


Qualifications & Skills

Education and Experience Required:


Four-year or Graduate Degree in Marketing, Data Analytics, Business or any other related discipline or commensurate work experience or demonstrated competence.
4-7 years of work experience, preferably in marketing, data analytics, market research, customer research or customer experience strategy, or a related field or an advanced degree with 3-5 years of work experience


Technical Skills


Proficiency in both Excel and Power Point, experience with data visualization in Power BI and SQL.
Familiarity with marketing analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics) is a plus.


Soft Skills


Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Clear and concise communication skills, with the ability to explain data findings to non-technical audiences.
Attention to detail and a proactive approach to tasks.

  • Attention to detail and a proactive approach to tasks.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Buscamos incorporar un Data Analyst o Analista de Datos para una agencia de marketing relacional, especializada en acciones de captación y fidelización de clientes, en Barcelona.


Sobre el puesto:

Necesitamos una persona con altas capacidad de análisis de ventas y gestión de bases de datos, para incorporarse al equipo especializado en acciones para la red comercial del sector automoción. La persona deberá gestionar los incentivos online que requieren tener capacidad para desarrollar las siguientes funciones:

Funciones:

* Análisis de necesidades funcionales (requisitos y modelos de ficheros base) para poder desarrollar un briefing de programación para back y un briefing creativo para front.
* Contacto con equipo de programadores y equipo creativo para puesta en marcha y cumplimiento de timings.
* Seguimiento de los proyectos (anuales) con carga mensual de datos y validación de resultados.
* Gestionar plan contactos mediante email marketing.
* Gestión del día a día con el cliente.

Requisitos:

* Licenciatura en Ciencias de la Información, Ciencias Empresariales, Estadística, ADE o similares.
* 3 / 5 años de experiencia en posición similar como Analista de Datos o Trade Marketing.
* Dominio nivel experto de Excel.
* Otras herramientas de análisis de datos serán valoradas, pero no imprescindibles (PowerBI)
* Alta capacidad de analizar y gestionar datos.
* Analista de ventas con experiencia en gestión de bases de datos.
* Inglés valorable, pero no imprescindible.
Hard skills:
* Sentido común y capacidad para aprender.
* Persona proactiva, curiosa, orientada a hacer su trabajo y también a mejorarlo. Buscamos una persona que ejecute unas funciones, pero que tenga capacidad de análisis y que interprete los resultados de su trabajo en búsqueda de mejoras.
* Trabajo en equipo: que sepa trabajar de forma autónoma e integrada al mismo tiempo dentro de un equipo.
* Persona activa y con iniciativa.

Si eres un profesional con experiencia directamente relacionada con la posición, el empleo de Data Analyst o Analista de Datos es para ti.

¡Inscríbete hoy mismo a este apasionante puesto y comienza ya un nuevo reto profesional!

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Overview

The Celergo Streamline Organization (CSL) is committed to providing World Class Service to clients by hiring, developing and retaining qualified service professionals; by treating each client contact as a service opportunity and by delivering outstanding customer care to clients and associates.

Within the CSL Implementation department we are looking for an experienced Business Intelligence Analyst to lead data analysis and reporting efforts within the department.

What will I be doing?


You will formulate analytical problems, extracting & analyzing data from multiple systems, summarizing critical findings/insights, and developing a compelling visual representation of analyses with actionable recommendations
You will work with multiple stakeholders to identify, design, develop and implement advanced analytics projects
You will acquire, clean and analyse large data sets and do exploratory analysis to understand our data and if it meets project requirements
You will design reports to help our management team make strategic decisions
You will be a champion for data-based decision making
You will drive the improvement in how we organise and classify our data across the Implementation department and beyond
You will help formulate our data analysis offering and produce new models to forecast future outcomes


What skills will I need?


You will have high ethical standards. You will understand the importance of keeping data safe and secure and ensure ADP and client data is safeguarded at all times
You will be able to extract data from core systems and understand how this data can be structured to make analysis more straightforward
You will be naturally analytical and will be able to see inconsistencies in data
You will be able to see through the numbers to spot trends in data and be able to model them to help plan for possible outcomes
You will be interested in discovering more about data patterns and automated decision making
You will be a born story teller. You will be able to make sense of large volumes of information. You will have a natural ability to find the useful information amongst reams of data and be able to translate this into simple charts or presentations to drive better decision making
You will be an Excel whizz. You will know your pivot tables from your data tables and will have macro programming abilities
You will have a keen attention to detail and the ability to produce highly accurate deliverables
You will be willing to roll up your sleeves and do the mundane work. Data will need to be cleansed; Master Data defined and taxonomies refined.
You will be a critical thinker who is able to see the bigger picture and challenge assumptions and established processes to improve productivity and efficiency
You will be a first rate communicator. You will be required to challenge teams and management in a polite but forceful manner. You will be expected to present your findings at Executive level
You will be able to manage demanding workloads including working to conflicting and changing deadlines.
You will be comfortable with uncertainty. Elements of your work will be new, and not everything will be defined precisely at the outset


How will I know that I am successful at it?


Data will be cleaner and more accurate as an outcome of the work you are performing
Your project reports will be the talk of the company. They will be clear and concise and will be used to support decision making at the highest levels
Your forecasts will be so accurate management may start to suspect you are a fortune teller


Qualifications And Experience


3 to 5 years of experience in reporting, business intelligence, data analysis or similar
Experience in project management and/or business improvement environments is a plus
Experience of working with BI tools and data visualization tools is required. Power BI will be a plus.
Expert Excel skills, include macro and Power Query. Dax, M, and SQL knowledge are a plus.
Proven ability to work within a team and independently.
You care curious, had expose to an international culture and ability to work in a multinational environment.
Efficient in at least English. Additional languages are pluses.
University degree or equivalent in education or experience.


A little about ADP: We are a comprehensive global provider of cloud-based human capital management (HCM) solutions that unite HR, payroll, talent, time, tax and benefits administration and a leader in business outsourcing services, analytics, and compliance expertise. We believe our people make all the difference in cultivating a down-to-earth culture that embraces our core values, welcomes ideas, encourages innovation, and values belonging. We've received recognition for our work by many esteemed organizations, learn more at ADP Awards and Recognition.

Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Equal Employment Opportunity at ADP: ADP is committed to an inclusive, diverse and equitable workplace, and is further committed to providing equal employment opportunities regardless of any protected characteristic including: race, color, genetic information, creed, national origin, religion, sex, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lawful alien status, ancestry, age, marital status, protected veteran status or disability. Hiring decisions are based upon ADP’s operating needs, and applicant merit including, but not limited to, qualifications, experience, ability, availability, cooperation, and job performance.

Ethics at ADP: ADP has a long, proud history of conducting business with the highest ethical standards and full compliance with all applicable laws. We also expect our people to uphold our values with the highest level of integrity and behave in a manner that fosters an honest and respectful workplace. Click https://jobs.adp.com/life-at-adp/ to learn more about ADP’s culture and our full set of values.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
From Barcelona, you will join Germany-based Corporate Start-Up B. Braun New Ventures, which is taking a leading role in the digital transformation of healthcare. With a young and fast-growing team, we develop solutions to automate medical procedures across various business areas. From our Barcelona location, you will be integrated into an international team that collaborates to achieve these goals.

Responsibilities:


Collect, analyze, and interpret complex healthcare and operational data to derive actionable insights that drive business decisions
Design, build, and optimize data pipelines and workflows using Databricks, SQL, and other relevant technologies
Create dashboards and reports using visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) to communicate findings effectively to stakeholders
Collaborate closely with data engineers, cloud architects, product managers, and software developers to integrate analytics into digital products and cloud-based solutions
Develop and implement statistical models, machine learning algorithms, and predictive analytics to enhance data-driven decision-making
Ensure data integrity, governance, and compliance with industry standards and regulatory requirements
Work in an agile and cross-functional team, contributing to the continuous improvement of data analytics strategies and best practices


Professional competencies:


Several years of experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in the healthcare, medical technology, or cloud-based product industry
Strong SQL skills and experience working with Databricks, Python, or R for data analysis and modeling
Experience with cloud data platforms (Azure, AWS, or GCP) and tools such as Delta Lake, Apache Spark, or Snowflake
Proficient in data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar
Strong understanding of data governance, ETL processes, and data warehousing concepts
Experience working in an agile environment with multidisciplinary teams
Familiar with machine learning techniques, statistical analysis, and predictive modeling (a plus)
Experience in the healthcare industry or a comparable regulated environment (a plus)


Personal competencies:


Proactive, results-oriented, and analytical thinker with problem-solving skills
Work effectively in multidisciplinary teams, encourage collaboration (including virtual teams), and foster mutual support
Hands-on mentality and a passion for transforming data into meaningful insights
Productive and capable of acting in critical situations
Communicate clearly and responsibly in English. Spanish and German are nice to have


B. Braun Medical, S.A. U. | Soledad Barragán López
Show more
HTML:
From Barcelona, you will join Germany-based Corporate Start-Up B. Braun New Ventures, which is taking a leading role in the digital transformation of healthcare. With a young and fast-growing team, we develop solutions to automate medical procedures across various business areas. From our Barcelona location, you will be integrated into an international team that collaborates to achieve these goals.

Responsibilities:

  • Collect, analyze, and interpret complex healthcare and operational data to derive actionable insights that drive business decisions
  • Design, build, and optimize data pipelines and workflows using Databricks, SQL, and other relevant technologies
  • Create dashboards and reports using visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) to communicate findings effectively to stakeholders
  • Collaborate closely with data engineers, cloud architects, product managers, and software developers to integrate analytics into digital products and cloud-based solutions
  • Develop and implement statistical models, machine learning algorithms, and predictive analytics to enhance data-driven decision-making
  • Ensure data integrity, governance, and compliance with industry standards and regulatory requirements
  • Work in an agile and cross-functional team, contributing to the continuous improvement of data analytics strategies and best practices

Professional competencies:

  • Several years of experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in the healthcare, medical technology, or cloud-based product industry
  • Strong SQL skills and experience working with Databricks, Python, or R for data analysis and modeling
  • Experience with cloud data platforms (Azure, AWS, or GCP) and tools such as Delta Lake, Apache Spark, or Snowflake
  • Proficient in data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar
  • Strong understanding of data governance, ETL processes, and data warehousing concepts
  • Experience working in an agile environment with multidisciplinary teams
  • Familiar with machine learning techniques, statistical analysis, and predictive modeling (a plus)
  • Experience in the healthcare industry or a comparable regulated environment (a plus)

Personal competencies:

  • Proactive, results-oriented, and analytical thinker with problem-solving skills
  • Work effectively in multidisciplinary teams, encourage collaboration (including virtual teams), and foster mutual support
  • Hands-on mentality and a passion for transforming data into meaningful insights
  • Productive and capable of acting in critical situations
  • Communicate clearly and responsibly in English. Spanish and German are nice to have

B. Braun Medical, S.A. U. | Soledad Barragán López

Title: Data Analyst, Tracking & Analytics
Description:
Are you eager to develop and implement tracking and analytics solutions that help large international companies make informed decisions? Do you want to join our ambitious journey within data tracking & analytics? Are you ready to to make a real impact on how global brands use data?

At s360, we're not just collecting data – we're turning it into actionable insights that drive business growth. Join our new team in Barcelona and help shape the future of ad-tech in a dynamic, startup-like environment while being part of a leading North European agency.

Your Key Responsibilities

You will play a crucial role in delivering and advising on tracking and analytics solutions for our clients. Overall your responsibilities will encompass the development and implementation of durable measurement and tracking setups.

More Specifically, Your Responsibilities Will Include


Responsible for own portfolio of clients within tracking & analytics
Driving strategic roadmaps towards a durable measurement setup
Planning, project management and execution as primary or part of projects for clients on an ad hoc basis
Advising and configuration of e.g. Google Analytics 4, Consent Mode, Enhanced Conversions, Conversion API, and Consent Management Platform (Cookiebot and Cookie Information)
Testing, auditing, and ensuring the quality of tracking setups
Developing documentation and implementing both smaller and larger tracking setups
Implementing and adjusting conversion tracking/pixel across various channels and platforms
Debugging and resolving ad hoc tracking issues


About Your Future Team

You will join our Measurement team who each day collaborate to make sure our clients succeed. We strive to work closely on projects, complex cases, and troubleshooting while having fun and prioritising the social aspects of working together. Staying ahead with the latest technologies and products is part of our DNA, ensuring our clients gain a competitive advantage through future-proof tracking setups.

Moreover, as part of our new Barcelona team, you’ll contribute to building a collaborative environment. You will help shape the growth of our office and contribute to building a culture that thrives on innovation, teamwork and the shared goal of delivering exceptional results for our clients.

Your profile

You have 4-6 years of hands-on experience from e.g. a digital agency or an inhouse role in a digital company. You possess high professionalism as well as personal integrity and thrive in a fast-paced environment, where we constantly strive to improve and create more value for our clients.

Furthermore, You


High-level user of Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager for ecommerce
Have a working knowledge on HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Have experience in driving larger tracking & analytics projects for complex setups and client organisations
Comfortable explaining complex and technical concepts both verbally and in writing
Able to communicate in English with colleagues and external stakeholders from various locations
Are a problem-solver, unafraid of tackling challenging tasks
Are detail-oriented and structured, taking pride in delivering thorough solutions
Have a direct and open communication style, and you are comfortable with giving and receiving constructive feedback
Appreciate collaborative sparring and knowledge-sharing within the team, coupled with the ability to work independently and manage tasks in a structured manner


Note: You must be eligible to work in Spain and the EU without requiring sponsorship.

What We Offer

You will be a part of a strong team with some of the industry’s top specialists who all strive to ensure that our next delivery is always better than before. You will join an international team working with clients across the s360 group.

Moreover, you will be a part of a company characterised by:


A culture that is down-to-earth and full of constructive feedback and sparring that drives your personal and professional development
Freedom under responsibility and flexible working hours
Ambitious and professional colleagues - who also like to have fun!
Continuous learning and development opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career.
Social events like our MeetUp for all s360-employees


Our office in the popular Norrsken House Barcelona offers the city’s best location with views of the beach and W-hotel, as well as many social and networking activities.

We’d love to hear from you!

Is this the right fit for you? Then don’t hesitate to apply or reach out to Andrej Plancic, Managing Director, at [email protected].

We review applications on an ongoing basis and hire as soon as the right candidate is found, so please send your CV and application as soon as possible. All inquiries are treated confidentially.

About S360

s360 is a leading Northern European digital marketing agency that helps brands and retailers grow by providing a strong tech foundation, best-in-class execution, and deep industry expertise. With a team of +300 digital specialists, s360 operates ten offices across seven countries: Denmark, Finland, Norway, Sweden, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands, and Spain. In recent years, s360 has been recognised with numerous national and European awards, making it one of Europe's most award-winning digital marketing agencies.
Show more

Title: Junior data analyst - data migration team
Description:
Junior data analyst - Equipo de migración de datos

Sobre El Puesto

Buscamos un/a Junior Data Analyst para unirse a nuestro equipo de migración de datos en el sector educativo. Esta persona será responsable de apoyar en procesos de ETL (extracción, transformación y carga de datos), análisis de información y validación de datos en sistemas ERP.

Responsabilidades


Colaborar en la recopilación, limpieza y validación de datos para garantizar su integridad y calidad.
Ejecutar procesos de migración de datos y dar soporte en tareas de ETL.
Analizar ficheros de datos para identificar errores, inconsistencias o duplicados.
Generar informes y dashboards para evaluar la migración y detectar posibles mejoras.
Colaborar con el equipo técnico en la optimización de procesos de migración.
Documentar los procedimientos y metodologías utilizadas en la gestión de datos.
Apoyar en la automatización de procesos y en la mejora continua de la migración de datos.


Requisitos


Grado en Estadística, Matemáticas, Ingeniería Informática, Ciencia de Datos o campos relacionados.
Experiencia previa en análisis de datos (prácticas o roles junior).
Conocimientos de SQL y bases de datos relacionales.
Habilidad en el uso de herramientas de visualización de datos (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Conocimientos básicos de Python o R para el análisis y manipulación de datos.
Capacidad analítica, atención al detalle y resolución de problemas.
Buenas habilidades de comunicación y trabajo en equipo.
Nivel intermedio de inglés y fluidez en catalán/español.


Ofrecemos


Contrato indefinido y modelo de trabajo híbrido en Barcelona.
Flexibilidad horaria y jornada intensiva los viernes y en verano.
Oportunidades de formación y crecimiento profesional.
Programa de beneficios flexibles


About Sanoma Learning

How do you prepare students for the world, engage their curiosity and inspire them to grow? That is the main question of teachers all around the world. At Sanoma Learning, it has always been our mission to help to find and develop best-in-class answers to this question. If you join us, it means that you embark on an exciting journey to help shape the future of learning for primary, secondary and vocational education. We believe that your journey is our success as a company.

Sanoma Learning is a leading K12 European learning company, operating in 12 countries. Our learning products and services enable and support teachers and schools to develop the talents of every child to reach their potential. By offering printed and digital learning content, as well as digital learning and teaching platforms for primary, secondary and vocational education, we want to grow our positive impact on learning across Europe. With over 3000 employees, we help shape the future of education for 25+ million of students.

So, are you ready to start your journey to help shape the future of learning and help teachers to support all students to reach their potential?

Sanoma Learning is an equal opportunity employer; we are committed to inclusion and diversity, ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or any other characteristics.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst, EMEA Performance Media
Description:
What You'll Do:

As a Data Analyst in our Analytics Performance Media team, you will drive advertising strategies thanks to your oversight of business objectives and technical expertise of our products.


Client insights: you will analyse complex data from multiple sources to understand the performance of our advertisers’ campaigns and generate innovative and impactful insights
Business strategy: you will partner with account executives, account strategists, and campaign managers to help drive client strategy and direction
Reporting tools and metrics: you will develop and scale reports and metrics that will present actionable insights to teams across the business and strategic leadership.
Testing: you will design, monitor and analyse A/B tests to understand better how our products work for clients.
Collaborative projects: you will work on ad hoc projects with different teams to automate analyses globally, improve our internal processes and our way of working and scale knowledge across the company



Your work environment:


Flexible remote working options - balance your life the way you want.
A tech-forward, primarily digital workspace.
Need special work hours? Let's talk about it!



Who You Are:


At least 2 years of experience in data analysis
A problem-solver with a passion for analytics and a logical approach to challenges.
Able to solve data problems using Python, SQL, and enthusiastic about automating and scaling solutions.
Business-minded with a goal to turn data insights into actionable strategies.
Team player who thrives in a collaborative, inclusive, and vibrant workspace.
You are skilled at simplifying complex concepts for diverse audiences.
Experience in online advertising, marketing, or consulting will be a plus.
Fluent in English
Must be eligible to work in Spain full-time with no restrictions.



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.
Show more

Title: DATA ANALYST
Description:
Somos una compañía global, líder en el desarrollo de infraestructuras regenerativas que generan un impacto positivo en la sociedad. Nuestra plantilla, formada por más de 65.000 profesionales y presente en más de 40 países de los cinco continentes, contribuye a nuestra misión de diseñar un planeta mejor. Buscamos personas que quieran marcar la diferencia, promover el desarrollo sostenible y encontrar soluciones a los mayores desafíos globales, incluidos el cambio climático, la sobrepoblación y la escasez hídrica. Únete a nosotros en la búsqueda de soluciones para lograr un futuro sostenible.

Descripción del puesto

El/La Data Analyst será responsable de la construcción y mantenimiento de dashboards en PowerBI, la definición y gestión de KPIs y la creación de data products para apoyar la toma de decisiones del negocio. Además, liderará la identificación, documentación y migración de los servicios de datos actuales hacia una nueva arquitectura medallón en GCP, asegurando la trazabilidad y gobernanza de los datos.

Requisitos del candidato

PRINCIPALES FUNCIONES Y RESPONSABILIDADES


Diseñar, desarrollar y mantener dashboards en Power BI que proporcionen información clave para las áreas de negocio.
Identificar y documentar los servicios de datos existentes (CdM, dashboards, KPIs, informes), asegurando la trazabilidad y calidad de los datos.
Liderar la migración de los servicios de datos actuales a una arquitectura medallón en GCP, garantizando la continuidad y optimización del análisis de datos.
Actuar como interfaz con las áreas de negocio para entender sus necesidades analíticas y traducirlas en soluciones de datos efectivas.
Colaborar con el Data Engineer en el diseño y modelado de datamarts optimizados para la explotación en Power BI.
Impulsar la gobernanza de datos en la empresa mediante la construcción de un Business Glossary y un Diccionario de Datos.


PERFIL DE LA PERSONA


Formación reglada: Ingeniería informática o similar.
Formación no reglada / Complementaria: Sólidos conocimientos de modelados de datos y definición de datamarts en entornos analíticos. Conocimiento de arquitecturas de datos modernas, preferiblemente en Google Cloud Platform, y experiencia en migraciones de datos. Conocimientos en Data Governance, con capacidad para estructurar y construir en Business Glossary y un Diccionario de Datos.
Experiencia: Más de 5 años en posición similar. Experiencia demostrable en el desarrollo de dashboards y modelos de datos en Power BI. Experiencia en la documentación de flujos de datos, trazabilidad y gobernanza de datos. Experiencia en SQL y herramientas ETL para transformación y análisis de datos será valorada.
Otros: Persona organizada, con iniciativa y sentido de la responsabilidad. Acostumbrada a trabajar en ambientes laborales dinámicos. Habilidades de análisis y comunicación para interactuar con steakholders de negocio y entender sus necesidades. Capacidad para trabajar de manera autónoma como el único Data Analyst de la Compañía, con visión estratégica y enfoque a resultados.


Somos una compañía que valora la diversidad como fuente de talento y por ello trabajamos para impulsar un entorno inclusivo en el que se promueve el respeto, la pertenencia y el compromiso de forma que todas las personas puedan participar en igualdad de oportunidades. Invitamos a todas las personas a inscribirse con independencia del origen, circunstancias, bagaje o condición. ACCIONA ha recibido la certificación Top Employer 2021, 2022, 2023, 2024 y 2025, que reconoce a la Compañía como una de las mejores empresas para trabajar en España.
Show more
