Title: Data & Business Intelligence Officer
Description:
About The Job

Global Markets is BNP Paribas’ capital markets business within Corporate & Institutional Banking (CIB), delivering solutions across asset classes, and industry-leading services for clients including Institutionals, corporates, private banks and retail distribution networks. Our Portugal Platform (Porto and Lisbon) is a major HUB in Europe and certainly unique in the country by its size and its scope of activity, with all Front Office roles present (Trading, Sales, Research, Structuring, Quant & Engineering, Business Dev and Support, Marketing & Client Support, Risk Management, Data Analytics and Machine Learning…). We are growing fast with the ambition to become even more relevant for the worldwide activity, which presents many short and long term opportunities.

Your Main Activities Are

The purpose of the role is to Drive the Business Intelligence for FX+, including (but not limited to) reporting on the activity, tracking of the business case, management of the Revenue Sharing Agreements, pricing and booking models enhancements, business development and tracking of the operational quality.


Monitor the FX Payments activity and the revenue sharing
Monitor activity KPIs (volumes, revenues, pricing …) for all geographies / clients
Manage revenue sharing with TB / DM / IRB partners
Track the FX+ platform performance and operational quality
Support the business development with accurate ad-hoc data analysis (pricing analysis, campaigns targeting and follow-up…)
Build a state of the art industrial “Client Intelligence” solutio
Establish key metrics, reports and alerts and requirements in terms of digital business performance, in close collaboration with the businesses, to measure activity and revenues
Contribute to the management of the product roadmap for Client Intelligence (extension to new activities, new countries, new client segments and needs …)


Profile And Skills To Success


Academic background in Engineering, Mathematics, Finance, Economics or similar areas (preferential)
Experience in a similar Business Intelligence
An overall understanding and interest in the financial world
Strong appetite for Digital technologies, support and foster a culture of continuous improvement
Experienced in defining and sponsoring projects and project management: business case and scoping study, management of the delivery along with Business Lines / IT / Operations
Fluency in English (mandatory)
Excellent communication skills and client focus
Strong team work while being able to work autonomously
Ability to work under tight deadlines and organisational skills
Strong Excel knowledge
Tableau, PowerBI and other IT coding Skills – (Intermediate)
Contribute to the management of the product roadmap for Client Intelligence (extension to new activities, new countries, new client segments and needs Contribute to the management of the product roadmap for Client Intelligence (extension to new activities, new countries, new client segments and needs …)


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.


Show more
HTML:
About The Job

Global Markets is BNP Paribas’ capital markets business within Corporate & Institutional Banking (CIB), delivering solutions across asset classes, and industry-leading services for clients including Institutionals, corporates, private banks and retail distribution networks. Our Portugal Platform (Porto and Lisbon) is a major HUB in Europe and certainly unique in the country by its size and its scope of activity, with all Front Office roles present (Trading, Sales, Research, Structuring, Quant & Engineering, Business Dev and Support, Marketing & Client Support, Risk Management, Data Analytics and Machine Learning…). We are growing fast with the ambition to become even more relevant for the worldwide activity, which presents many short and long term opportunities.

Your Main Activities Are

The purpose of the role is to Drive the Business Intelligence for FX+, including (but not limited to) reporting on the activity, tracking of the business case, management of the Revenue Sharing Agreements, pricing and booking models enhancements, business development and tracking of the operational quality.

  • Monitor the FX Payments activity and the revenue sharing
  • Monitor activity KPIs (volumes, revenues, pricing …) for all geographies / clients
  • Manage revenue sharing with TB / DM / IRB partners
  • Track the FX+ platform performance and operational quality
  • Support the business development with accurate ad-hoc data analysis (pricing analysis, campaigns targeting and follow-up…)
  • Build a state of the art industrial “Client Intelligence” solutio
  • Establish key metrics, reports and alerts and requirements in terms of digital business performance, in close collaboration with the businesses, to measure activity and revenues
  • Contribute to the management of the product roadmap for Client Intelligence (extension to new activities, new countries, new client segments and needs …)

Profile And Skills To Success

  • Academic background in Engineering, Mathematics, Finance, Economics or similar areas (preferential)
  • Experience in a similar Business Intelligence
  • An overall understanding and interest in the financial world
  • Strong appetite for Digital technologies, support and foster a culture of continuous improvement
  • Experienced in defining and sponsoring projects and project management: business case and scoping study, management of the delivery along with Business Lines / IT / Operations
  • Fluency in English (mandatory)
  • Excellent communication skills and client focus
  • Strong team work while being able to work autonomously
  • Ability to work under tight deadlines and organisational skills
  • Strong Excel knowledge
  • Tableau, PowerBI and other IT coding Skills – (Intermediate)
  • Contribute to the management of the product roadmap for Client Intelligence (extension to new activities, new countries, new client segments and needs Contribute to the management of the product roadmap for Client Intelligence (extension to new activities, new countries, new client segments and needs …)

Why joining BNP Paribas?

  • Leading banking institution

BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.

  • Our presence in Portugal

In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.

  • International reach

Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions

  • Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
  • Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
  • Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
  • Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

  • Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

  • Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal

  • Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
  • In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Business Intelligence Associate
Description:
Who we are




Metyis is a global and forward-thinking firm operating across a wide range of industries, developing and delivering AI & Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing & Design solutions and Advisory services. At Metyis, our long-term partnership model brings long-lasting impact and growth to our business partners and clients through extensive execution capabilities.

With our team, you can experience a collaborative environment with highly skilled multidisciplinary experts, where everyone has room to build bigger and bolder ideas. Being part of Metyis means you can speak your mind and be creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you can achieve with a team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.

We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.




What We Offer







A balanced work environment where you will have autonomy, responsibility, and ownership while working with a vibrant and dynamic team.
A modern office with everything you need (including food and beverages).
Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.




What You Will Do




Design visually appealing and business useful reports.
Understand client requirement and suggest right technical architecture.
Developing technically efficient, fast, useful and appealing reports.
Technical problem solving - good knowledge of DAX and data modelling.
Preparing and facilitating workshops.
Managing stakeholders and communicating with executives.




What you’ll bring




3+ years of experience in PowerBI/ BI design and development.
Prior experience in customer facing role across functions is good to have.
In-depth understand of data modelling and basics of azure environment.
Solid understanding and working experience of other BI tools and powerapps.
Profound knowledge of the English language.




In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

Title: Data Analyst (French Speaker) | BPCE-SI
Description:
Company Description

Natixis in Portugal is a Centre of Expertise whose mission is to transform traditional banking by developing innovative solutions for the business, operations and work culture of Groupe BPCE worldwide.

Natixis in Portugal is part of the Global Financial Services division, where it applies technology for the development of financial expertise in its two global business lines – Corporate & Investment Banking and Asset & Wealth Management – and, transversally, for the entities of Groupe BPCE.

The Centre of Expertise, based in Porto, currently has more than 2,400 employees from over 30 nationalities, organised in three main departments: Information Technology, Banking Support Activities and Compliance. These teams work in an integrated, inclusive and transversal way, supporting and creating value for all the business lines and platforms of the group. The project in Porto is one of the biggest investments in Human Resources ever made by Groupe BPCE worldwide.

A disruptive mindset and a culture of proximity and agility identify Natixis in Portugal Team and reflect the company's mission to transform traditional banking at a global scale: a perfect match in the Portuguese dynamics and entrepreneurial ecosystem.

In 2024, Top Employers Institute has awarded Natixis in Portugal the Top Employer Portugal accreditation for the second time. This certification recognizes excellence in people practices, following the example of our head office, in France, who was certified Top Employer France for the eight year in a row.

Job Description

Within the IT department of Natixis BPCE-SI, in Distribution et Data, within the Data Team Context:

Natixis is the corporate bank, of management, insurance and financial services of the Group BPCE, the second bank player in France with 36 million customers through its two networks, Banque Populaire and Caisse d'Epargne.

With more than 16 000 employees, Natixis intervenes in three fields of activity within which she(it) has strong business expertises:the Bank of Big Customers, the Savings and the Insurance and Specialized financial services. Corporate functions.

It accompanies in a long-lasting way, all over the world, its own clientele of companies, financial institutions and institutional investors and the private individual clients, professionals and SME of both networks of the Group BPCE.

We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Data Analyst to join our team. A strong background in data analysis, statistical methods, and data visualization is required. Work closely with various departments to gather data, analyze trends, and provide actionable insights to support business objectives.

Key Responsibilities:

Data Collection and Management:

Gather and clean data from various sources, including databases, spreadsheets, and external APIs.

Maintain and update databases to ensure data integrity and accessibility.

Data Analysis:

Analyze large datasets to identify patterns, trends, and correlations.

Use statistical techniques to interpret data and generate actionable insights.

Reporting:

Create comprehensive reports and dashboards to present findings to stakeholders.

Prepare visualizations using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Excel to communicate complex data in an understandable format.

Collaboration:

Work closely with cross-functional teams, including marketing, finance, and operations, to understand their data needs and provide support.

Collaborate with data engineers and other IT staff to improve data collection and processing methods.

Business Insights:

Provide recommendations based on data analysis to drive business strategies and improve performance.

Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and report on progress towards goals.

Continuous Improvement:

Stay updated with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and visualization.

Identify opportunities for process improvements and implement solutions.

Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL,
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI).
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Familiarity with statistical methods and data modeling techniques is a plus.
Must be french-speaker, at least C1


Additional Information

#MuchMoreThanJustAJob

Early morning. Campo 24 de Agosto. In 4 minutes, you are clocking in at the office. Start your day having breakfast with the Team and grab fresh fruit on the way to your seat, in one of Porto’s most typical neighborhoods. This Purple Day is going to be a busy one: daily meeting ensuring all team members are on the same page regarding work status, priorities and blockers, language class and, just after, a Talent Management meeting with your manager, discussing your career path.

Lunch break. Today, your Team is onboarding newcomers, but also welcoming French colleagues: the perfect excuse to walk downtown and bond over a francesinha. When returning, inhale nature and peace of mind in Natixis Urban Garden (look at the crops; ready to harvest!).

Back inside. Brainstorming session on a new, exciting project in our disruptive and immersive Manaus Village. The afternoon went flying (tasks, meetings, some jokes with your teammates). End it on a high note: celebrating cultural diversity with a Diwali, the Indian festival of lights.

Tomorrow, you attend a conference led by influential speakers in your industry and, the day after, you will work from home, benefitting from some focus time to complete that report and soft skills course on LinkedIn Learning. Once you are done with your work for the day, strike the right note playing with Natixis band or be part of a board games session. If that is too steady for you, meet your colleagues to catch some waves or sail the Douro river during golden hour.
Show more

Title: Financial Resources Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job

The Financial Resources Data Analyst plays an important and accountable role in providing support on the management of Global Markets Resources, namely Liquidity, Balance Sheet and Capital and the monitoring of future regulations.

The Financial Resources Data Analyst measures, allocates and optimizes Resources to ensure that the operational entity grows revenue, market share, and profitability in a sustainable way.

Your Main Activities Are


Collect, Prepare, consolidate data and Monitoring and keep track of Gaps on Global Markets Resources.
Responsible for database production and maintenance.
Assist on the preparation of presentations on topics related to Global Market resources.
Provides assistance to incoming requests from different regulators.
Responsible for producing GM Resources metrics, following a continuous improvement mindset (acquiring and building knowledge on the different business Lines, units and organization).
Develop knowledge on technical skills and apply those in order to efficiently perform the tasks.
Build knowledge and understanding on the 5 main types for Global markets and Help monitor those - Credit; Counterparty; Equity; Market; Operational.
Build knowledge and easiness in the main tools and software used by the team.


Profile And Skills To Success


Bachelors/MSc in Economics, Finance and Accounting
Very good communication skills
Analytical ability, attention to details, autonomy
Ability to collaborate/Teamwork
Proactivity
Risk management - Risk analysis
Technical skills – R, VBA and Python

Title: Junior Data & Analytics Consultant - French Speaker
Description:
Company Description

Hitachi Solutions Europe is a global Digital, Data and Technology consultancy, Microsoft Solution partner and Cloud Services partner, specialising in end-to-end transformation.

As a global consultancy company working across the private and public sectors, we specialise in Dynamics 365 Business Applications, Power Platform, including Azure, Application Modernisation and Data & Analytics.

Our highly skilled team help drive improvements, creating efficiency and growth within organisations. We are committed to Microsoft technologies, with a mission to revolutionise modern businesses. To achieve this we employ the best, most dedicated talent to deliver outstanding technology solutions to both our local and global clients.




Be part of our Hitachi family

Hitachi Solutions Europe has several opportunities for graduates based in Portugal. Applicants should have a keen interest in technology, plus a desire to pursue an international career in consulting.

Hitachi Solutions Graduate Learning & Development (L&D) programme will inspire you to become our next generation of Hitachi Consultants. Working from our office in Porto, with the opportunity to work around Europe, this an exciting opportunity to be part of a company that believes in investing in people for the future. Our well-structured L&D programme is tailored to train you to become the best consultant you can be.

The programme fits perfectly with the Hitachi Solutions company vision of growth and our slogan Inspire the Next. Working with us offers a fantastic prospect to be part of a company that thinks ahead. As such, we actively encourage applications from graduates who are team players, adaptable, problem solvers and eager to learn.




Job Description

What to expect, your role

A Data & Analytics Consultant is responsible for supporting the capturing and detailing business processes and needs from our clients, through workshops, meetings, and documentation.
On a daily basis, you will be backing the team in developing data analytics solutions to support the effective operational, tactical and strategic decision making.
As part of this role consultants will be expected to:
Support the development of data solutions in Azure (using technologies such as Synapse Analytics, Fabric) to ingesting various sources into a unified data platform.
Design and deliver scalable PowerBI reports that provide actionable insights for a wide range of clients.

(throughout the L&D programme you will receive training to prepare you for these tasks)




Qualifications

Newly qualified graduates with less than three years’ professional experience.
Degree in Data Science, Analytics, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics.
Fluency in English both written and oral.
Fluency in French both written and oral.
Credible client facing personality.
Strong presentation/communication/facilitation skills (oral and written).
Good problem solving and analytical skills.
Good knowledge of Microsoft Office productivity tools.
Knowledge of data systems and SQL (Preference).
Knowledge of BI tools e.g. Power BI, Tableau (Desirable).
Knowledge of programming languages e.g. Python, DAX/M, SQL, C#, R (Desirable).
Good organisational skills.
A strong sense of responsibility and autonomy.
Ability to work independently and well within a team.
Availability to travel abroad.
A demonstrable passion for technology.




Additional Information

What to expect, your benefits

Career development: we assign you a personal Career Development Mentor (CDM) to support. and guide you during your journey with us.
Flexible and friendly work environment (hybrid work model, work-life balance).
Competitive salary.
Health insurance.
25 annual leave days.
Mobile phone and public transport allowances.
Employee Assistance Programme.
Be part of one of the best IT consultancy companies in the world.

Title: Repository Admin and Data Quality
HTML:
Dellent is a consulting company focused in System Information and Telecommunications. Our goal is to help our candidates and consultants to take a step forward in their careers through projects that meet their needs and expectations.

This project is part of the business investment banking and financial services area, and currently has its technological hub in Porto and is working on the development of innovative solutions and support for all operations related to the business.

We are looking for a Repository Admin and Data Quality to work in this project in Porto (Hybrid).

Requirements

  • Strong organizational (methodical), interpersonal (co-operative, constructive and open-minded), problem solving, communication and analytical skills;
  • A real passion for learning, doing things better and helping others – and an ability to turn ideas into realities;
  • Availability to travel abroad for short periods of time, as required;
  • Business Analyst experience;
  • Working experience in a user support role directly assisting and interacting with clients to address client requests;
  • Experience organizing and tracking your users’ relationships;
  • Able to understand IT subjects, mainly about system integration and data services throw APIs;
  • Excel and data manipulation;
  • Fluent French is essential;
  • Good level in English is desirable;
  • Knowledge on PowerBI (nice to have).

What can you expect from us?

  • Health insurance;
  • A personalized training plan, with a budget to spend on the training and technical books you find necessary;
  • Constant feedback so you can grow professionally;
  • Remote onboarding process;
  • Team events every semester so you can live new adventures;
  • Culture of proximity and transparency. Your ideas and needs are heard and valued by us!

Apply

If the above sounds like the kind of job opportunity you would want to get involved with, then please do not hesitate to apply here. You can also explore our content about the job market here.

Title: Business Analytics Technician
HTML:
A Frulact é um grupo empresarial internacional fundado no Porto em 1987. Atualmente, posicionamo-nos como um player inovador de topo no fornecimento de ingredientes de valor acrescentado para a indústria alimentar e de bebidas, apostando em preparados de frutas, alternativas lácteas à base de plantas, sabores líquidos e outros ingredientes especiais.

Somos mais de 900 Frulacteanos levando know-how aos nossos clientes a partir das nossas fábricas de produção localizadas na Europa (Portugal, França, Alemanha e Suíça), América do Norte (Canadá e Estados Unidos) e África (Marrocos e África do Sul).

A Frulact pertence à Ardian, uma empresa de investimento privado líder a nível mundial, e a sua sede está situada na Maia.


Estamos à procura de um Business Analytics Technician para o nosso departamento de Strategic Business Development na Maia.


RESPONSABILIDADES

  • Preparar análises para apoiar a tomada de decisões do negócio;
  • Apoiar administrativamente a área de controlo comercial;
  • Dar apoio e acompanhar de forma administrativa a estrutura comercial na preparação do orçamento anual, revisões e atividades operacionais;
  • Acompanhar a execução de mapas de gestão da carteira de clientes;
  • Auxiliar na preparação de estruturas de preços para apoiar as negociações com os clientes e o desenvolvimento de produtos;
  • Gerir e fazer a manutenção de bases de dados de clientes, materiais e preços;
  • Preparar a informação do mês de encerramento (inquéritos; INES; …);
  • Assegurar o seguimento da metodologia de vendas da equipa comercial.


PERFIL

  • Formação académica em Gestão de Empresas ou área similar;
  • Mínimo 1 ou 2 anos em funções similares (preferencialmente)
  • Bons conhecimentos em inglês (oral e escrito);
  • Conhecimento técnico avançado em Excel;
  • Conhecimento em SAP (preferencialmente);
  • Proatividade, espírito de equipa e orientação para resultados.

Title: Senior Data analyst
Description:
Scope




Our mission as a Corporate Digital Transformation team is to support EVS activities by improving business processes, managing corporate applications, structuring, and governing corporate data.

The modernization of our legacy data architecture into an Azure data platform, the definition of a new data governance and the reinforcement of the data team highlight our willingness to unlock the power of data and to become a fully data-driven company.

The Data Analyst’s role is to understand business requirements, collect and analyze data, and provide data products to stakeholders. He/she is responsible for supporting the utilization of Power BI and improving data quality and will work closely with various teams to ensure that data is accurate, accessible, and strategically used to enhance business performance.




Job Description




The data analyst will be part of the data team and will work under the guidance of the Data & BI Coordinator. He/She will play a key role in understanding business data usages, gathering requirements, and providing reliable datasets to data consumers.




His/her role will be to :

Collaborate with key stakeholders (Data owners, reports owners, data stewards) to understand business needs and collect data requirements.
Collect, analyze, and interpret data to build prototypes of data products.
Implement data pipelines respecting development standards in Azure Synapse.
Support the creation and maintenance of Power BI dashboards and reports.
Train and assist users in utilizing Power BI effectively.
Ensure data accuracy and consistency across various systems.
Ensure that all relevant technical and functional documentation is up to date.
Monitor, troubleshoot, and resolve any issues related to data pipelines.




Profile




Qualifications :

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
3+ years of experience in data engineering in Microsoft Azure environment.
Certification PL-300: Power BI Data Analyst Associate is a plus.




Soft skills :

Strong customers focus with the ability to manage expectations appropriately, constructively challenge requests and build a long-term relationship with key stakeholders.
Team player, autonomous and well-organized.
Excellent oral and written communication skills in English, minimum level : C1. French is a plus.
Positive, pragmatic, and problem-solving mindset
Good analytical skills
Focused on quality and accuracy
Will to learn and continuously evolve




Technical skills :

Must have

Proven experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role.
Power BI
First experience with Azure Synapse and its components.
Experience with data modeling, ETL processes, and lake house.
Strong knowledge of SQL and other data querying languages.




Nice to have

Microsoft D365 (Customer Engagement and Finance & Operations) knowledge is a significant asset.
Experience in working with 0365, Atlassian JIRA, Confluence, Azure DevOps and UML diagrams/BPMN annotations will ease the onboarding.




Offer




Becoming Part of the EVS Team not only means that you will receive a competitive salary in line with your skills and the market, but also a range of other additional wellness and healthcare benefits. Our flexible schedules and hybrid way of working (homeworking) policies will help you preserve your work-life balance. EVS will give you the tools to develop your skills and your career by giving you the opportunities of internal mobilities and a wide range of trainings. We encourage our motivated talents with a friendly, lively, and inclusive environment.Check out our website if you want to know more about why you should join EVS !
